Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: beachprincessnetty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the night after getting off the plane late...really enjoyed it, the staff friendly and helpfu. We found a few things not up to standard, and when it was brought to their attention, they quickly compensated with free breakfast for all at the coconut grill! Definetly would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay or small budget”
Reviews.Author: carriesk
Reviews.Content: Our reservation said poolside room but we were given a room in the lower level of the wing farthest from the pool. We had a view of a hedge. Not the most beautiful way to start your Hawaiian vacation but we were so tired we really didn't care. The pool and check-in area was clean and the staff was very, very friendly. Our room reeked of stale cigarettes even though they are non-smoking rooms. My brother's and sister's rooms were fine. You can feel every spring in the mattresses and the walls had many coats of paint - our bathroom door wouldn't even close. The shower, however, was super powerful so that was refreshing. You can hear everything through the walls so you sometimes wonder if someone is using the shower in your room. Be sure to ask Toni (the parking attendant) for recommendations on places to eat. She is super friendly and gave us some great recommendations. Our reservation included breakfast at the attached restaurant the next morning. It was very good and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Budget motel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: ColletteV
Reviews.Content: This is just a budget friendly, quaint little seaside hotel. We booked the "Superior" room with free breakfast for one night before heading over to Lahaina the next day. The room was quite large and the shower was very powerful! All in all, it was just a good place to crash for one night!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near airport and seaport”
Reviews.Author: michael0357
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in the Maui Seaside Hotel beginning of March. The hotel is a motel-style accomodation near Kahului Airport, Maui Seaport (stop of cruise ships) and near some shopping malls of Kahului. It's more a place to stay one night upon arrival or prior to departure than to spend your whole vacation. Unless you have got a room to the garden/pool side it's a bit noisy during the night, since there is a highway nearby. The mentioned pool is nothing fancy but sufficient to cool down for some minutes. There is also a sandy beach in front of the hotel, but the view on the commericial harbour doesn't allow too much of holiday feeling. The ladies at the reception were very friendly and helpful. Our hotel room (Deluxe) was real big with two King-size beds, plenty of space arround and a standard bathroom. We had booked overnighht including breakfast. Unfortunately they don't offer a buffet style breakfast but some set courses, which do not always meet everybodys taste. However, brakfast was ok and you don't expect a five-star kitchen at that price level. There is plenty of parking space arround the hotel, unfortunately we had to pay five USD in addition to the normal room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Motel With Very Sweet Staff”
Reviews.Author: MVO747
Reviews.Content: The staff were very sweet. I did not know of the free breakfast untill just now so missed it ! I was mad about the $5 parking charge but got nervous when signs all over the place said "sorry parking sold out tonight" For some reason I was offered a pass.....and of course bought it right away. Next guy didn't get one so I was lucky. Used the pool.....great for a quick swim. The weird part of the stay was noticing that just about every guest was a smoker ! My room had a no-smoking sign inside but reeked of smoke. yuck ! I ended up coughing for the next two days. The room was big and quiet. It was perfect to sleep overnight after a long flight......but I was glad my next stop was a beautiful 4 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality is not their strong point”
Reviews.Author: reenow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Seaside in Kona and the difference between Kona Seaside and Maui Seaside is drastic! They are not accomadating at all. When they say check in is at 3pm, they do not mean 250pm or 259 pm, for that matter. The breakfast was great...but if you book it through THEIR own website, you are not entitled to free breakfast. Even then...the staff did not want to be there, waiting on customers! Everything seemed like an inconvenience to the staff! Ask a question about local dining, etc and they are short...go to the mall....they have everything. All in all, you get what you pay for but then they charge you for everything else. $5 a day parking; internet access!!! Are you kidding!! I would have rather paid an extra $20 to be treated as a guest and not an inconvenience to them. Pay the money, people...Seaside is not worth saving a buck...trust me. KPNA SEASIDE was great, however and I ould stay there again. I can actually say that the rooms were very clean

Reviews.Title: “Marginal but close to airport”
Reviews.Author: DSMtravel
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a one night stay because we were arriving on a late flight and wanted to stay near the airport. It is very conveniently near the airport, but easy to miss when you are driving by on the highway. The hotel was not great. Everything in the room felt sticky. Soundproofing is poor. One good point is the made-to-order free breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Go early to avoid the line at the door. They have a nice view of the ocean and cruise ships dock nearby. This is not a place for a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “typical cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: daviddms20
Reviews.Content: This hotel did provide a shelter for us to stay in and for that it's good enough. It is the closest thing to cheap that Maui has to offer and is close to the airport for convenience. The parking has room for improvment. The parking space is limited and they still "sell" you parking passes for those limited spots. All others ark at a gravel lot outside hotel property and walk to your room. Internet is an additional charge and the laundry facility is only open certain hours, which puts a damper on vacation plans when you have to wash laundry on someone elses schedule. Having used this hotel now, I'd use it if I had to but I'll certainly be looking for something else next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but great!”
Reviews.Author: Trudy B
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was very nervous about going to the Maui Seaside Hotel. But I can honestly tell you, it was great. We did not go in there expecting a 5 star hotel. It was a package deal...air, hotel and car rental. Our room was huge. King size bed, fridge, new air conditioner. It was clean. No bugs. Grounds were very well kept. Friendly staff. Contintental breakfast every morning was awesome! Staff in restaurant was great! Greeted us every day. Hugged us when we left. Check in staff was awesome. There was some upkeep going on. Replacing of carpets, air conditioners, bedding. Painting was happening. Re -tarring of the roof. It IS an older hotel, but would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great price”
Reviews.Author: rosestogo2000
Reviews.Content: We needed a last minute hotel for one night and figured we would just have to make do. What a pleasant surprise! We ended up staying three nights. The room was spacious and very clean. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Our room included a free breakfast at the on-site restaurant so it made the price of the room even better. We didn't use the pool but it was well maintained with fresh towels daily. Parking is a little tight with a little walk but no different than most parking in Hawaii and very doable.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay before flight back home.”
Reviews.Author: l33anna
Reviews.Content: The Maui Seaside Hotel was a good place for us to stay before flying back home. For the price, it was the best and it was fine for us after being on the resort side for a week. Obviously it is not the Marriott, but still good enough for us. A little out-dated, but still clean. The restaurant was a little expensive for the food, but we were able to walk down to the Shopping Center and see a movie before our flight which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Locally Owned Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Konagirl004
Reviews.Content: My room was excellent. It was clean, spacious and comfortable. Check in was fast and friendly. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is not into a five star upscale property. The Maui Seaside is for the type of person that wants a small, friendly and home like atmosphere. I will definitely being spending all future vacations to Maui at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for budget travelers. More like a motel.”
Reviews.Author: Imamom
Reviews.Content: The room was a basic motel room. It is fine for a place to stay inexpensively. There is an outdoor pool and hotel is on the beach. We checked in around 9 pm. There was no close parking left (small fee) and we were sent around the back for free parking. This wouldn't work if you have mobility problems, so get there early. No upgrades were available by this time either. So, if you want a chance for an upgrade and a better place to park, check in early. There was a small lobby and pleasant covered outdoor area near the check in desk where I saw people playing cards, visiting, etc.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay a-okay.”
Reviews.Author: mauilover0517
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night 2 weeks ago because we landed at 9pm and didn't want Mom & Dad to have to drive from Lahaina to pick us up so late. I would not want to stay here for a full week unless I needed to be right next to the airport or community college. Our room was perfectly clean & suited our needs for a place to get 8 hours sleep & a shower. Only 2 bath towels provided in the bathroom so had to get one more from the maid in the hallway. Also only conditioning shampoo not separate shampoo & conditioner. Good air conditioner & ceiling fan so you have your choice of what you prefer for cooling. Was able to layout by the pool for about an hour after breakfast before checkout & it was very pleasant. The buildings shelter the pool area from most of the wind. Pool water temperature was too for me to swim in. Got a good AAA rate that included free breakfast. Longs Drugs walking distance in case you need anything. Our cab ride from the airport was $15 including tip. Take a book/leave a book shelf in the lobby area. Shrimp Truck near the comm. college also has amazing food!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a spot for vacation”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl907
Reviews.Content: Im sure if you're here for business or work it's a place to sleep. But the hotel doesn't offer much more than that. If you're here to enjoy a vacation or relax this is NOT the place to be. The staff are a nice group of locals however the location is on the windiest part of the island, I woke up tired( unable to sleep the night before), and had to request that our room be vacuumed a couple days in. In all, if you're looking for a nice get away, a relaxing venue, this is not the spot you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better”
Reviews.Author: lizochka65
Reviews.Content: We wanted an inexpensive central hotel for a clean and quiet place to sleep after long days of exploring Maui. For the most part, this is an adequate hotel and it was surprisingly quiet, given the relatively busy location and number of guests booked over the holiday weekend (except for the chicken coop under our window, but we have wild chickens where I live in Honolulu so maybe I am accustomed). The hotel is a bit over priced, given the lack of amenities; we were told to pay $5 a day for parking, which was overbooked, so we parked off property in a nearby park. WI-Fi in the room had almost no signal, and at $8.95 per day, was not worth the expense, anyway. Beds were rather wobbly but we slept OK. The water pressure in the shower was excellent. We spent as little time in the hotel as possible, because we had lots to do, but the hotel reeked of cigarettes in most areas and it seemed very run-down inside (the grounds, however, were in beautiful condition).

Reviews.Title: “Very good lodging”
Reviews.Author: budgetqueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights. Very nice hotel, large very clean, quiet room in the "budget" section. :) For Maui, it was a good price. I did purchase the plan with the included breakfast which wasn't the best option as I had early snorkle trips booking two of the mornings, and the restaurant did not open until 7am, which could be considered "later" for the breakfast crowd.. The free parking was fine, and I appreciated the non pay option. One negative is their online booking feature of booking beds. You can't book specific bed options. I had to email the request for two beds, and got a reply that it was "noted". Did a follow up call, since the two beds were necessary for me. It would be far better to get online confirmation of bed numbers and types when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, somewhat deceptive amenities”
Reviews.Author: MNSandSeeker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Seaside Hotel on Feb. 11 for one night. I was looking for a place near the airport for our last night on the islands. First appearance upon entering the parking lot was "I hope the inside looks better than the outside." I had booked through a travel website and the package I selected was described as "Standard 2 Doubles Garden View Including Breakfast...Free Breakfast valued at $25 for two... Free Wi-Fi." We arrived at about 2pm and the desk attendance said we could not check into the room until 3pm. We left to get lunch and came about 2:45pm. Many people were waiting at the front desk for them to be assigned a room. I tried to access the free internet and asked the front desk for the code. The internet page stated that free access to the internet is in the lobby by the front desk - only. If you want to access the wifi in your room or other area of the property it required you to pay $8.95 per day. EACH time I logged off or stepped out of the free wifi area, I had to go back to the front desk, ask for another code and enter it. The room... we were assigned our room and told it was in building 3. Building 1 and 2 (both two floors each) are on both sides of the outdoor pool. Building 3, which has 3 floors, looks like it may have been a different hotel at one time. Upon entering the room, it appeared to look fine. The room space itself was large. The beds had the used-a-lot appeareance, flat not round topped. It was nothing fancy, but it was clean. The room had a large window so I went over to look out. Our "Garden View" room had a view of the roofs of buildings 1 & 2, power lines, the west Maui mountains in the distrance; look to the right and see the water in the bay. If I put my head to the glass and looked straight down, I could see the grass between buildings 2 & 3, but I would not consider this a garden view by any means. Property pros: fairly inexpensive for Maui, but I think still overpriced for the age of the buildings and what you get. The pool was clean and grounds around the pool is maintained and nice. The building does have a narrow beach by the bay. There is a restaurant onsite, another one block to the east, and there is a nice Italian restaurant across the street. Close to the airport, a Whole Foods grocery store, a gas station and the cruise port. Not far from Queens mall. Coin operated self laundry facilities on the property. Property cons: The pool closed at 6pm!!! Not really a garden view. Free internet only in lobby or pay other areas. Long pass code required to enter each time. Staff that smiled but not necessarily friendly. Use of public computer in the lobby - need to hand over your drivers license at the front desk for use of the keyboard for the computer. The restaurant on the property closed at 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, very clean. Very pleasant and nice staff The food was wonderful, very good and reasonably priced. The included breakfast with 3 choices was excellent Located near everything including airport

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our budget and need to be close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMomma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Seaside Hotel on our 1st night (late night flight in) and last night of our vacation (early flight home the next morning). It was basic, but clean, and just what we needed to be close to the airport. The in-room refrigerator was handy, coffee pot was nice too. The tight parking was $5 and we did not receive a free breakfast. However, I would like to note that the restaurant right next to the hotel served a wonderful breakfast, and was reasonable (considering Hawaii's costs). We would recommend this hotel for a quick night when you need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Know why you're staying here”
Reviews.Author: daytripperNewYork
Reviews.Content: There are many different reasons why you stay at certain places. Sometimes it's to get away from the crowd, sometimes because you want something romantic, sometimes you want to save money and sometimes you want a convenient area. If you stay here, know why you're staying here. If you do it right The Maui Seaside may work out for you. Here's what it isn't. 1. It's not luxurious 2. it's dated 3. it feels unremarkable, you may notice in the halls a dingy lit area, maybe the smell of smoke 4. the room we were in is not going to win any awards for views as ours had a look out to the parking lot. 5. if you have a lot of bags, you better have strong arms for the long distance you may have to haul although the elevator works in helping you get there. 6. The fridge in the room is tiny. 7. The bathroom works but it's not beautiful. 8. The beds were ok, but you'll hear a fair amount of traffic. 9. the lobby is active with people trying to get on the internet. 10. The pool is available but I saw no one swimming there. 11. There is a view of the north shore and it's not bad. You'll see people of all ages coming here to stay or to eat at the Coconut Room, which is average. And ..... if you read the other reviews provided you'll find there are truisms all around. Everyone's point of view here is on target. So why stay here when there are certainly other places that are far way better? Well.... 1. It's close to the airport. 2. It's cheap 3. It's family run. Which is great when you consider much of the Maui economy is run by chains which are not local at all. So the money stays in Maui. 4. A lot of people stay here, some for extended periods. They must like it for a reason and they're nice people. 5. The service is truthful, which means it's good for what it is. A value oriented place to stay. You will notice on Maui that staying in Kahului is as romantic as an industrial byway with a strip of highway full of car dealerships, fast food restaurants etc. Yet.... You can always get in the car and picnic on a coastal area. Hana Highway is nearby. You'll be near all the conveniences of life like shopping centers and fast food. If you're a student on a budget or a retired couple watching your pennies, you've come to a place which can help you out. If you are looking for the ideal escape or the lap of luxury, spend a lot more money somewhere else. So.....know why you're staying here (for us, we had an early morning flight) and if you care about certain things and don't care about other things, this may be the right place for you. I recommend Maui Seaside.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Maui on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Postvr8
Reviews.Content: The location isn't great, it's close to the airport, but not near any attractions. There are nicer hotels in Lahaina, but you'll pay a lot more. This hotel features a pool, ocean views, close proximity to the airport, & a very friendly staff. The rooms, including beds & linens, need to be updated, but it's adequate and priced accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, All about the Location”
Reviews.Author: GE1972
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a convenient spot to overnight and catch an early flight, this is the place. Nothing fancy. Pretty dated, but things are clean and adequate. Reasonably priced rooms. The hotel is located across the street from a shopping mall with a Long's Drug and a Whole Foods, if you are in need of any supplies. Cable TV in rooms, A/C, ceiling fans. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but near the Airport.”
Reviews.Author: MO2cats
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight and needed to be close the airport in Maui. There was the only hotel I could find, but then I did notice one right next door, which looked less desirable than where we stayed. It served the purpose, but I certainly would not want to spend many of my vacation days here.

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: gapcmp
Reviews.Content: This beachfront hotel in Kahului, Maui is o.k for a quick overnight prior to a flight. The property is old but reasonabaly well maintained and the rooms are small but clean. Charging $5.00 to park in an open parking lot is a bit much for this property. There are not a lot of choices in Kahului but look around. Free breakfast with our package helped to revive us after a bad night. The untrimmed tree rubbing against our back wall in the strong winds was a problem throughout the early morning hours.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel with gigantic king spider”
Reviews.Author: gummybeary
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days in this hotel. Our package didn't include the free breakfast. Wifi in the room cost another $8.95 per day. But its's free in the lobby. The room is old and outdated. Parking is $5 per day but there's free parking. The worst thing is there's a huge crazy looking king spider in our room coming out of nowhere. We called the front desk and they seems not care. They finally sent a mantaince guy to kill it. It was horrible experience. I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Find some better one and it's closed to the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “should've done more research..”
Reviews.Author: soundtweakers
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week here, and definitely will not return to the same hotel. Old and spooky, charges for parking when available spaces are usually a long walk right next to free public parking area. I'm not at all a demanding for posh accomedation type, but this place is simply horrible. Free breakfast was okay, same three choices daily. Room price seems cheap but if you add wifi charges, parking charges, you can get much better places in seaside towns such as Lahaina and Kihei for around the same cost. If you are planning on your first Maui trip, my advise to you is to not stay in Kahului, go for Kihei and Lahaina if you are budget concious and travel with family.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely the WORST..”
Reviews.Author: George H
Reviews.Content: Booked this online for my family thinking that it would be a decent place. Boy was i wrong.. the staff was not friendly, the area was sketchy and the rooms were OUTDATED.. I found it funny how they charged for parking when theres a lot next door for FREE! Rooms we're ok, VERY outdated and used.. My son woke up with several bites that I'm not too sure of (maybe bed bugs or mosquitoes?) The free breakfast was mediocre at best. I wouldn't recommend this.. pay the extra $$ and get a better hotel elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation, close to OGG airport”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Maui Seaside Hotel is a basic motel styled place that about 5 minutes by taxi from Maui's main airport. The Coconut Grill on site is a good meal option and provides breakfast in the room rate if you opt for that. There is upscale Italian across the road and Burger King close by. The hotel is family run and the staff were friendly and organized. The room was clean and there were US sockets for charging in a strip next to a desk. The bed was comfortable. Internet access is available in the lobby on 2 large Imacs. There is a pool and there is access through a gate for walks near the seaside but there is no real beach here. The hotel was 100% booked full in January. The rooms are large but very BASIC with overhead fan, in wall air conditioner, flat screen TV and average sized bathroom with modular shower over bath. I could not log into Skywave internet ($8.95 per day) in the room, others has no problem. Parking was $5 extra per day. Overall the hotel is like a Days Inn that is perhaps 1980s vintage and in need of redevelopment but seems to be well run. My room cost $US112 per night, which raises questions about value but the Market rules! This place will be too basic for some people but is well situated for business, eating and airport. It is not near any of the major tourist spots on Maui. For those that need a higher rung option a new Courtyard by Marriott is being built: http://news.marriott.com/2011/04/mauis-first-courtyard-by-marriott-breaks-ground-in-kahului.html.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie R
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Front desk staff were never very cheerful and seemed quite unhappy really. Do not be fooled into paying for parking on the grounds as the free parking is literally next to it! If your not sure ask to check it out first. Our room was obviously in the oldest part of the hotel (2 story block on right when facing the ocean) and the room was so dark due to tinted glass and the fence being a metre from the window that we needed to have all the lamps on when we were in there just to be able to see. It was very bleak and overall quite dirty, especially the carpet which I didn't even like to walk on with bare feet. We were staying for 5 nights and had we known before hand we would not have stayed here. Although it is cheaper than others I just don't think it is worth the saving. On a positive the hotel is walking distance to two shopping centers with lots of food options and a movie theatre. One of the food outlets is a Wholefoods supermarket and just fantastic. Lots of healthy options and although pricey it is definitely worth it. I am vegetarian and this place was an absolute blessing. It rained the week we were there so didn't swim and the beach in front of the complex didn't look ideal for swimming as many boats pass by so not sure of water quality?

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - close to airport”
Reviews.Author: TVandAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night due to a late flight into Maui. I would stay here again for the same purpose. The hotel is very close to the airport and easy to find. The staff is very friendly. Handy restaurant is attached to hotel for an average breakfast before you head out (our meal was included with room) The room was neat and clean - that was my main concern. Bed was comfortable. Two chairs outside to sit and look at the bay and pool in the centre (we had a ground floor room). Parking is $5 or free just beside the hotel. Either option is fine and close. We paid the $5 but ended up parking just beside the free parking as it was late and the closer paid parking was full. No safety issues for car or contents that we could see..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for those looking to explore the island”
Reviews.Author: sullyryno
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for and travelers should understand that. The property itself and its amenities are not able to compete with many of the other resorts on Maui, but then again you cannot beat the price at the Maui Seaside. I would recommend this hotel to anyone flying in late to Maui or looking to explore Haleakala, going on snorkeling trips or other day excursions. My wife and I recently spent our honeymoon on Maui and spent the first 3 nights here, and then moved to locations in Hana and Wailea. Our first 3 days were hectic and we literally only slept here.This was a perfect location for us, as we got up early to watch the sunrise on Haleakala. The staff was very friendly and there was a pool, but we did not use it. Wi-fi was available as well, but we did not use it. The rooms are large but outdated, but they were clean and for the price you simply could not beat it. Those posting negative reviews obviously wanted to stay at a 4 or 5 star resort but pay a 2-3 star price.....that just doesn't happen.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: SpinnerDolphins
Reviews.Content: We found this place to be the best in terms of being conveniently near the airport and the malls, it was well kept. The best thing was that the rooms had a good sized fridge and microwave which was very helpful if you want to keep snacks in your room. The downside is the internet speed is very slow in the rooms if you choose to get Internet in your room. Also the beds are not all that comfortable, but overall a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Old and creepy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Colesjr
Reviews.Content: Two couples stayed here on a layover and will not return. Hotel needs serious updating. Hair in sink bed and bathtub. I would have hoped for holiday inn express standards for 120 dollars. The free breakfast for 2 was adaquate. Hope we don't have to use this property again. 5 bucks for parking and no shuttle service. Wifi system of having to get a 10 digit code every time from front desk is lame. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Room was very clean and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie C
Reviews.Content: -Would stay here again; we were here December 2011 -Close to airport which is why we opted to stay here -Staff was very friendly and helpful -We upgraded to a superior room which had 2 double beds and had a nice view of the pool and ocean (would recommend as it was only a few dollars more) -The grounds and pool are immaculate; there was lots of staff attending to the grounds, cleaning, maintenance of the property etc so it looks well it is well kept up -The rate was very reasonable for the 3 of us and included a very nice breakfast at the Coconut Grill restaurant -Room was very clean, bathroom newer, had a small fridge in room and place to hold luggage etc -Quiet area; had a great sleep. Beds were comfortable. -Air Conditioning -It is only about 5 minutes from the airport, shopping centres and COSTCO so a good place to stay pre and post your fly

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: YassStainbach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night. I selected this hotel, since we had an early morning flight. It is located only 2 miles from OGG. The room was clean and comfortable, and the hotel has a nice restaurant, a pool. The room fee was $105 including tax, and I paid $5 for parking. It was good value for the cost. Location was good, so it is also good for long stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Very nice staff!"”
Reviews.Author: Josie H
Reviews.Content: I booked our first night on Maui here because our plane got in very late and I didn't want to have to go far (with three tired children). It is not a new hotel by any means but I was happy that they upgraded our room to a kitchenette which included a day bed so our daughter didn't have to share a small double bed with her brothers! The staff was all very friendly and helpful! I would not stay for more that a day - it is a great jumping off point or place to stay before you go to the airport. You do have to pay for everything, internet, parking, but welcome to Maui! Unless you stay at a resort with all fees included, that is the way it is. I do have to say the breakfast is awesome. It is not a buffet but a sit down with a choice of three breakfasts. It is only for two people though, but we took ours to go and it was a lot of food! It is clean, the bed comfortable and the kitchenette fully stocked, but definitely not a $100 a night hotel back home. As per other reviews, "for the price it did the job"!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: KarenIG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight because it is so close to the airport and we had really long flights. It is an old hotel, but it us clean and good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Only the most basic of accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Saskheat
Reviews.Content: This is barely a 2 star. Dont expect much and if youre picky find elsewhere as you will be sadly disappointed. I paid $95 on expedia by booking 3 weeks in advance. I knew what I was getting into thanks to trip advisor, so I dont feel cheated. Did I get what I expected...yes. Did I get what I paid for? No, its over priced by 25% but its MAui. One complaint I have is that they charge $5 for parking. Come on guys. This just give you a black eye and yes others do it too but that just leaves people with a bad taste in their mouth in relation to the whole state. Just hide it in the nightly rate like everyone else in the world does. I stayed the remainder of my trip at the Maui Banyan and they had a beautiful 3 storey parking facility and didnt charge it. Also this is a MOTEL, not a hotel. The international standard for hotel is more than 2 stories and interior corridor access to rooms, so call it what it is. I had a good stay al be it short. The beds were traditional motel firm but linnes were good. The rooms were clean but dated furnishings and bath fixtures. The motel looks like it was constructed in the 40's and is showing its age. You can only paint over bulging dry wall so many times. Staff were awesome. This is a family run place. Choice of 3 hot table service Breakfast meals was included. Im assuming this is what the parking charge went towards. The property grounds were neat as a pin and the grounds keeper was like the energizer bunny. There was a security guard on at night. 2 hours of wifi avail in lobby for free upon request. Would I stay here again ...depends. Would I come here specifically for a vacation...not on your life.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kurzew
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Maui Seaside. Very decent hotel for the price. Near to the airport, car rentals and shopping centre. Very helpfull and kind staff. Complementary breakfast. Room was small but very clean, bathroom also. Swimming pool on site and private access to the small beach. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Seaside”
Reviews.Author: akbskt
Reviews.Content: Decent place...not fancy, but certainly adequate, clean and pleasant. Friendly staff, easy walk to several malls, nice beach area for walking, good price point which made it affordable for several nights. Great breakfast included in the cost of the room. Taxi costs were minimal too.

Reviews.Title: “not bad and cheap”
Reviews.Author: 711hayes1711
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night on Maui since it's so close to the airport. The location is very convenient to the airport, and there are a few restaurants close by as well. I wasn't expecting much, due to the pictures I had seen, but it was very clean and we got good service from the front desk. There is a little beach there, and we enjoyed our time at the pool. The price was great, and breakfast at the restaurant on the premises was cheap and great!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night before a flight....”
Reviews.Author: RaeannaManila
Reviews.Content: I was choosing the lesser of two evils when selecting a cheap and cheerful hotel in Kahului for one night before my early flight. I dreaded the thought of staying here, but was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't as bad as i expected based on the reviews. The pool was unfortunately out of commission when I arrived due to renovations. The front desk staff were full of aloha and very friendly. From the garden you can watch people fishing off the front beach and pier. Location is pretty convenient - close to the airport, car rental returns and Whole Foods and Safeway. room was clean, and comfortable enough. Complimentary WIFI available at the lobby for 2 hours (renewable). Parking on premise is USD5 which is a bit nuts, but you can park for free at the grassy lot next door if you so choose.

Reviews.Title: “Maui on a budget”
Reviews.Author: bj2011cali
Reviews.Content: We are here on our honeymoon and the Maui Seaside Inn turned out to be an awesome surprise. We didnt want to spend all of our money on the resort fees and over the top hotels. This spot was real value for the money. With it being in the center of the Island we were able to site see all of the main spots with easy coming and going. The locals told us where to go to see the most of the island. Great spot.

Reviews.Title: “OK choice near airport”
Reviews.Author: tom12345
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Hotwire. You don;t get a veranda with Hotwire just a large window. No breakfast and on site parking is $5. Room OK, but has window AC, not central AC. Quiet large room. Free coffee in room and has a mini refrig. Medium sized pool

Reviews.Title: “Bad end to a great vacation. Stay in Kihei...it's only a half-hour drive to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Surfinsmoothie
Reviews.Content: Arrived to be berated by the security guard for pulling into the check-in area the wrong direction, though it's not signed and the guard's golf cart was parked in the actual entranceway. Non-smoking room smelled strongly of smoke. Second room okay, but lots of funky smells in the halls and elevator getting there. The place is dated, dirty feeling, and pretty much the only bad part of an otherwise excellent week-long vacation in Maui. Our condo in Kihei was better and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay for a few days”
Reviews.Author: ElementTent
Reviews.Content: The Maui Seaside was a good place for us. The location was the best for sure and the view of the harbor was quite nice. Rooms were average but quite large. The mini-fridge was nice to store our water and drinks in during the hot days. On-site laundry came in very handy during our stay. Close to the airport and the mall, this is a good spot as a base for the entire area. The rate was good and the breakfast was enjoyable. The paid parking sucks a bit, but there is lots of it and close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Maxim ACES-V Review”
Reviews.Author: Maxim_LV
Reviews.Content: The Maxim ACES-V Review - Accommodations: This is where Maui Seaside earns its stripes and makes it a worthwhile place. The rooms are much larger than most in this price range, they're clean, and there's a mini-fridge and coffee maker in the room. The downside is the place is old, the hallways are dark and a bit dingy, and if people are talking in the hallway, consider yourself a party to it even if you're lying in bed. Parking is $5, which is a bit ridiculous in the area. (4/5) Cleanliness: Just splendid. (5/5) Extras: Bar soap, shampoo/conditioner combo, coffee maker with 10% Kona coffee (actually pretty good). Wi-Fi on your own device is only available for free in lobby and you have to get a code for it, otherwise is $8.99/day (insane). There are two computers in the lobby, but to use those, it's a $5 fee for 24 minutes (odd). There's a small pool with some chairs around it, and there's a small beach access. Not the cleanest water though, and you can see the shipyard from the sand, so you can only imagine how much diesel you're swimming through. (3/5) Service: The cleaning staff is quite nice, but maybe that's because you're handed a paper upon check-in encouraging you to tip them when you leave. The check-in staff is hit or miss; while I checked-in the lady to the left was helping someone with a huge smile. The young lady helping me talked to her co-worker about me as if I weren't standing there, and ignored most of what I said (I speak perfectly fine English). (3/5) Value: Being close to the airport and having decent sized rooms make this place worth visiting, but it isn't special, and their nickel-and-dime attitude is a bit disconcerting.

Reviews.Title: “good enough”
Reviews.Author: Geli2460
Reviews.Content: It is not a upscale hotel for sure, but adequate enough. Room is clean, front deak personel are helpful, etc. Parking is free if you are willing to walk 5 minutes. It locates in a very good central area which is easy access to lots of places in maui. Nothing is free there. you have to pay internet and parking is $5 if you want to park right in the hotel. I sent a two-page fax and that cost me $6. It is not that expensive but things can add up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Best service we had while in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Melis60882
Reviews.Content: I spent the month of July on 4 different islands... I stayed at 3 corporate resorts, and this small family-owned hotel. I have to say, the staff here was much friendlier, attentive, and more professional than any of the other three larger resorts. It is more of a budget hotel as opposed to a resort- but our rooms were clean and modest, nice view of the water, pool was clean, etc. Some of the rooms have a kitchenette. We were able to do breakfast and lunch "in", and went out for dinner. Good location- could get to shopping centers, beaches, airport quickly. Lahaina was maybe a 30 minute drive, and that's where all the touristy resorts/restaurants are. I was here with a student group for 10 days.... I would have no problem returning with my own family in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Dive hotel!”
Reviews.Author: liv2travel_9
Reviews.Content: Scary! Looks like a really old motel 6! don't stay here unless you bring some protection.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: jwmerrell
Reviews.Content: This a family owned hotel, the staff was very frendly. This is an older hotel coud us some renovating, This not is a fancy resort. My room 3012 was huge could have easliy put three beds in there. Internet is $10/day if you want in your room or free in lobby. Parking is $5/day. Some raes include a free brakfast whicih is pretty good. No iron of ironing board in room which was an issue as was here on business. I also stayed at the Maui Beach Hotel next door, whcih I thought was slightly better, but I would say here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, close to airport, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: SM1234085
Reviews.Content: Cheap, clean, mini fridge, free coffee, close to airport. Not for those who need a resort experience: we want a simple, clean place to crash at night and that's exactly what we got Free cooked breakfast (read eggs, toast, sausage, fresh fruit) was included in the deal: this was awesome unlike the stale muffins many hotels try to pass off as free breakfast You do have to pay for parking & wireless internet. Highly recommend parking just outside the hotel for free. The hotel staff will even give you directions to the free lot, literally 1/2 a minute and equally safe (the hotel parking that you pay for is mostly outside the actual hotel premises, open and not even walled).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: worldisabook
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night from a flight and didnâ€™t want to drive further to the beach resort areas at night with kids in tow so we stayed closer to the airport. We had two options for a one night stay in Kahului. This hotel was rated higher with a few of the travel sites than its neighboring Beach Hotel so we booked it. We didnâ€™t expect too much even after booking a â€œsuperiorâ€� room for $10 more than their standard room and knowing this was an older hotel. However, even with low expectations, it was still disappointing. The rooms werenâ€™t the cleanest and were in dire need of upgrades. It was definitely more of a motel. The hallway was dingy and dark. We were in the â€œtowerâ€� section which was really just a three-story building. We caught a glimpse of the rooms overlooking the pool and it had the same dÃ©cor and furniture as ours. There were no ironing boards in the rooms but were available at a room next to the restaurant with the washers and dryers. We had to use it and those ironing boards had certainly been used a lot and needed replacements. Parking was an extra $5 or free if parking on the dirt lot a building away. We decided to pay the $5 and parked in their lot although it was pretty crowded when we got there and the security guard had to help us find a spot. The best thing about this hotel had to be the location. It was across from the Queen Kaamana mall (Mauiâ€™s largest mall) and was also on a street with the Maui mall nearby for plenty of restaurants and stores including Longâ€™s Drugs and Whole Foods. The major stores (i.e. Costco, Wal-Mart, and Kmart) were all nearby to stock up on supplies and souvenirs. There was a small strip of beach behind it good enough to walk around but wasnâ€™t too inviting for a swim. The staff we encountered was all friendly and courteous. Another good thing was the complimentary breakfast for 2 adults at the Coconut Grill restaurant within the hotel. We probably would only stay here again if were stranded at the airport. In hindsight, we should have driven to the Kihei area for another 30-40 minutes for better lodging selections.

Reviews.Title: “good value place to stay in kahului”
Reviews.Author: Dee0811
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. upon check-in the reception staff were kind enough to upgrade us to the junior suite without us asking (we had booked the standard room). The room was in a quite location as requested, away from the parking lot, and had 2 flat screen tvs, one in the bedroom and the other in the lounge/kitchen room. Although the bedroom was dark (with only small horizontal window near the ceiling), we found it to be clean and comfortable. There was a large fridge and kitchenette. we didnt do any cooking here but even if we did, it would be difficult because we couldn't locate any plates/bowl/cuttlery in the kitchen. The hotel charges guests for parking, which we found unusual. but all in all, good inexpensive place to stay near the airport for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: VTbrooklyn04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night after a long flight from Atlanta. We didn't spend too much time at the hotel or in the room but we liked the location, it was a safe hotel with security, the breakfast was really good at the restaurant (free always helps!) and the staff was very sweet. We'd definately stay here again if the right situation arose.

Reviews.Title: “We start every trip to Maui here.”
Reviews.Author: OKtoGOnow
Reviews.Content: Every trip to Maui starts with us arriving late from LAX and heading straight to this motel. This property is a very good value and the staff is very nice. We spend our first night here, have breakfast, wait for Costco to open at 10, then head for our resort. This is an older property at a good price so have reasonable expectations and don't be uptight. Relax and enjoy it for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, noisy aircon, smells of dope, damn noisy with rooster wakeup!”
Reviews.Author: Jono_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: On the surface, it looks clean and elegant, a classic hotel. The location and parking are pretty handy too. But we changed rooms 3 times trying to get a decent nights rest. The first room had a rattling noisy airconditioner, and we were woken up by a stupid rooster after 5am. We tried changing, but the next room smelt so foul, with the bathroom so pungent from weed, that we didnt bother opening our bags. The 3rd room wasn't too bad, the aircon was a bit quieter, and it was okay. Breakfast in the hotel was pretty good, although service is friendly but can be a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Dated rooms, but very clean.”
Reviews.Author: rainn2001
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, but we would have preferred the Lahaina area instead. It's a clean hotel along the ocean for a reasonable price. Overall enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quick overnight stay after landing late & before heading across the island”
Reviews.Author: TheCaliTraveler
Reviews.Content: For my purposes this hotel was great. I was landing late after flying for over 24 hours from Europe. I knew i'd be exhausted so I didn't want to drive the 45 mins to Kaanapali (or pay for an expensive resort just to sleep!). This property was clean. Great simple breakfast was included at the restaurant adjacent -- a bit on the small side but perfect for me. The staff was accommodating when I was a bit concerned for my safety and put me in a room near the office. The safety concern was mostly because I was a single female traveler arriving late to a lot of locals hanging out in the parking lot - just gave me a weird vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: Riverrat13
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel since our plane arrived at midnight our time & we did not want to drive far. Our room was tiny and very stuffy. The AC was not even on; were they not expecting us?? When we turned it on ( a small window unit in a hole in the wall-very inadequate) it never cooled the room, even after running all night. There was a used band-aid on the floor and overall the place was run-down. The grounds are alright, beach access was easy. I did not try the breakfast because even though there were 3 of us traveling, they only gave us 2 breakfast vouchers. The fridge also was not on when we checked in and did not cool until hours later when I turned if off then on again. There was absolutely no way an ocean breeze could have come through the room and we spent an uncomfortable night. Couldn't wait to leave the next morning. I am very glad their price was so reasonable because I would have hated to pay more for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Close to shopping and Bus stop”
Reviews.Author: mitan
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price. Big room with nice ocean view. The only problem is the aircon unit is too small for the size of the room. It will take a long time for it to cool the room.

Reviews.Title: “we would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: 38491pat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there 6 nights starting mar. 29 2011 and were very happy with the room, restaurant, and front desk. We asked about the Luau in Lahaina and they called to set up a date right away. We went to maui to travel the island and see the sightes, not to stay in the hotel and be pampered. I would tell my friends to stay there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “**Caution** This hotel is a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: PaulinOmaha
Reviews.Content: **CAUTION** This hotel is a DUMP! There were BUGS in the room, the bathroom fixtures were falling off the walls, the window air conditioner was set into a hole cut into the outside wall, and it sounded like a BUS ENGINE, (and so did the one in the room ABOVE US), the blankets resembled BRILLO PADS; they served HORRIBLE FOOD at the restaurant; the pool not only CLOSED at 6pm every night, but was ICE COLD and contained ZERO chlorine. They charged 20 CENTS per minute for internet access, the front desk had no area maps available, the "scenic bay" behind the property was actually a ship loading dock, and overall, the entire stay was DEPLORABLE! Since there were no other hotels available by the time we checked in, we were forced to spend 8 days in this HOLE. Even the "free breakfast" ordered "from the menu" was a lie. FALSE ADVERTISING all the way! They gave us little slips of paper that offered three (3) breakfast choices, as if this was the "menu", but we were NOT allowed to choose anything from the restaurant's breakfast menu! The servers in the restaurant clearly did NOT want to be there, and each morning, when the food DID finally arrive, it was always either over-cooked, or cold. And as their ad says, "wake up early..." this wake up service is provided by the maintanance crew that begins pounding on things at 7 am! Do yourself a favor and choose ANY OTHER HOTEL in the area but this one!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accomodating, clean with beautiful view of bay.”
Reviews.Author: missyl52202
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Maui and we were looking for an inexpensive, nice place to stay. We stayed the whole six nights here and had a wonderful time. We swam in the bay, walked to local restaurants and rented a car to get around. The staff was friendly, very accomodating and kept our room very clean. Our 22 month old loved playing on the lawn and walking us to the restaurant every morning. Breaksfast came with our package and it was very good. I loved the Banana bread. We paid for parking 5.00 a day and compared to some places this was very cheap so no big deal. The Coconut grill closes for lunch early and does not serve lunch on the weekends so make other plans. Great burgers and pancakes with coconut syrup. Over all, we were very pleased and would definelty stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean rooms, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Sharonlynn53
Reviews.Content: We stayed our last night in Maui as it was close to the airport. I only have two complaints regarding our stay First and most important, in all our travels, we have never had to pay to park at the hotel. Here, if you want to park in their lotl they charge you $5.00 but they do have a place you can park free just down the road. $5.00 isn't much but we were surprised. On the other hand, we each got a free breakfast that was well worth more than we paid for parking. Secondly, they charge for internet and most hotels suppy internet at no charge. Not a really big deal. As for the hotel, the pool is nice and they are on the beach. The rooms are big and clean and the restaraunt on site has wonderful food. We found the staff to be friendly and very helpful. We would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget choice for Maui vacation”
Reviews.Author: crm114_discriminator
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly satisfied with all aspects of this hotel. It's a great choice for anyone on a budget, just minutes from the airport and is a great staging point for trips throughout Maui, especially the Hana Highway. We paid about $445 total for four nights through Expedia, including taxes. We received a free breakfast each morning that was quite good. You get three choices for breakfast. It's located on the harbor-front and has beach access, a nice pool and very attractive grounds. It's an older faciltiies, 1950s or '60s era but is fairly well-maintained. The room was spacious, utilitarian. The beds could have used a new mattress. The bathroom was fine and there's an extensive channel selection on the flat-screen TV. It also came with a mini refrigerator. You can pay $5 a night for parking, or park for free in an adjacent dirt lot. The free lot worked fine for us. There are numerous restaurants, markets and other services nearby. You're on the main drag but it's quiet on the grounds and in the rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this for anyone seeking an affordable stay. It's not a snazzy resort, but a clean and convenient hotel that is well kept-up despite its age.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Sunnydaze105
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Maui Seaside. The bed was REALLY comfortable and the central location was great, a short trip to everything there is to see in Maui. I wouldn't recommend paying for parking as the free lot is only a few steps away from the secure lot you have to pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great restaurant, shame about the receptionists.”
Reviews.Author: ElJennino
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about our stay at the Maui Seaside. We showed up a bit early to ask if we could drop our bags off until check in, but the receptionist would not let me speak, she just kept telling me that 'check in not until 3.' I tried to tell her I understood that, but could we please offload our bags but she seemed disinterested. She registered us in the end, but our room was unavailable but she gave us a parking slip - which cost $5 per night (which was the cheapest parking we encountered anywhere in Hawaii) but had to leave our bags in the car. We came back at 3 to check in and the same girl served us. She told us to take a seat while she checked to see if our room was ready. Half an hour later we were still waiting. Obviously we'd been forgotten as the girl had gone home! Eventually we got to our room which had been ready for awhile according to the other girl that served us who seemed to think our dilemma was amusing. (We were not amused). My only other criticism was when the next day I asked the receptionists for some directions, I had to wonder if the woman behind the desk was all there. She seemed very reluctant to acknowledge my existance let alone help me. I realise these people get asked these questions 1000 times a day, but if you're not prepared to do that then get another job. I've done that job, and a little bit of curtesy can go a long way; even if it is forced at least you have tried. OUr room was nice, exactly what we paid for which was no frills. just somewhere to sleep, shower and take five. The pool area was very nice though, and we enjoyed a couple of meals at the restaurant the Coconut Grill. Service there was excellent, we found the food to be delicious and the prices very affordable.Shout out to our server Jonathan if he should read this - you ruled!

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort, but not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: Leatherspike
Reviews.Content: A decent place for what we paid. Some reviewers complain that this isn't a $400 dollar a night resort, but that isn't what you're paying for. We booked this hotel through priceline and weren't supposed to get the free breakfast, but they threw it in anyway. The breakfast consisted of eggs, sausage, toast, and potatoes and was really good. They do charge for overnight parking, but there is a free parking lot right next to the hotel. We were not nickel dimed at all. Cell phones work everywhere so why would you make calls on the hotel phone anyway. We have stayed in resorts in Wailea and Kihei before, but were on the road or at the beach all the time anyway so we decided to stay at the much less expensive Maui Seaside and were extremely happy. I would compare this to a Best Western or Super 8 with a free cooked to order breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stop”
Reviews.Author: TruthtoPower
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights, the first of which was a late arrival. Our room (in the "Tower" section) was OK, but if I were to come here again, I'd ask for a poolside room (the 100s). Our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Grounds were immaculate. Pool clean and inviting. Complimentary breakfasts in the adjacent Coconut Lounge were tasty, equally competitive with any B & B. Staff throughout the aforementioned Coconut Lounge and in the Seaside itself were all aloha-friendly and uniformly helpful with advice for us newcomers to Maui. All in all, a nice place from which to launch the rest of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed after getting in late at night”
Reviews.Author: Amanda253
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night after arriving in Maui late at night. It was our first time in Maui and we did not want to deal with renting a car or trying to find our way around at the late hour we arrived. This hotel is close to the airport (a $12 cab ride). Our unrenovated room was badly in need of updating. However, the bed was surprisingly comfortable and we had a good sleep. We went to the nearby Ale House for a drink and snack after we arrived. It was fun and we can recommend the Maui 'Big Swell IPA'. The next day we took a $12 cab ride to Enterprise to rent a car, and headed to our resort. If we stayed there again we would spring the $10 or $20 for an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for a night stay”
Reviews.Author: Perstime
Reviews.Content: Located near the airport, close to shopping centers, and malls, but would've been better if it's close to a swimming beach or a great tourist attraction... Rooms were clean, neat, and spaceous, furnished with bathroom toiletries and kitchen equipment, for those prefer to cook.. We weren't offered the free breakfast as we expected, and you have to pay to use their wifi and or computers, no shuttle to airport, and additional daily parking fee of $5 The hotel person I've spoken with in the morning wasn't very helpful to us but the others were very accomodating. I would recommend this place to a person whose on a tight budget but not to a person who can afford more.

Reviews.Title: “You do not get what they advertise!”
Reviews.Author: Paul n Despina V
Reviews.Content: 1st and foremost, you pay for any and all ammenities...to include local calls! They try to treat it like a B&B without the breakfast. The ammenities are not at all what they advertise on top of the additional charges. Parking is outragous!!! An upgrade is honestly no better than the room you started with by any means and there isn't a view of anything from most rooms. I would only stay here again if I was very low on funds. The best part of this stay was the distance to convient stores and the airport. Would pay all the extra for a resort farther from the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay after flight”
Reviews.Author: JoyM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a serviceable hotel right on the harbor in downtown , only a short drive from the airport. It is a decent value for Maui . The rooms are nothing to write home about, but they are ok for a short stay. The main drawback to the hotel is that you will want to get out into other more scenic areas of Maui, or to the regular beachside hotels, rather than to stay here for more than a night, in most cases. However, I am sure people do stay longer here, and the pool is very nice, the view across the harbor is good, and you are not far at all from the other side of the harbor (driving though, not walking unless you like a longer walk) where people surf on boogie boards a lot. The restaurant Cocoanut Grill is a decent place for a breakfast and the wait staff was nice. In fact, the service was fine at this hotel. The people were nice. The decor in the rooms isn't that attracitve but it is clean and serviceable. If you walk across the street at the light right outside the hotel and about a block up that cross street, there is a small older mall on the left, and it has a great indoors farmers market. I think the market is almost every day of the week (Maybe not Sunday, and I don't think a lot of vendors are there on Saturdays). I'd recommend it as a place to get some food (avocado, banana, etc- there are also cooked meals available there and other baked items) to take for the rest of your trip, esp when you are starting out, as Maui restaurant costs are high and besides, you will want to sample the produce. Of course fruit and vegetable stands are all over the place in Maui, but this farmers market is the real thing and gives you a chance to select from a wider variety of food than any roadside stand. Taking an avocado for lunch with some fruit is a great healthy substitute for buying restaurant food. For some reason the hotel staff didn't recommend this market when I asked about where to buy bottled water, but there is water and soda for sale at the market as well. If you are on a very tight budget, this is one of the cheaper hotels around (still not 'cheap' like many places on the main land); it's just not close to the main scenic areas or swimming beaches, or at least, you have to drive to get to them.

Reviews.Title: “Servicable place to stay the night before catching your flight, but expect to be nickel-dimed.”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maui Seaside Hotel the last night of my trip to Maui because I had an early flight. I wanted to be near the airport and didn't want to pay for my expensive Wailea room that night when I would not be around to enjoy it the next day. For my purposes it was fine. I was given a second-floor room and since the door lock appeared to be quite sturdy I felt reasonably safe. The room was clean and bug-free and while the amenities were not luxurious there was shampoo, soap, conditioner, sewing kit and shower cap, plus a hairdryer. There were people camping in the vacant lot next to the hotel, but they quieted down by about 10 PM so they weren't a problem. The hotel seemed to be full of people on their first or last day of vacation and a large group of young surfers. There was a little bit of noise earlier in the evening but things quieted down by 10PM. The hotel posts rules about quiet hours, and apparently enforces them. I got a good rate through Hotwire ($75). They charge an extra $5 for parking, which annoyed me to no end. I would rather pay $5 more for the night than be nickel-dimed. Also, they don't have an airport shuttle so if you don't have a rental car, expect to pay another $15 for a cab. Rental cars are so cheap on Maui you might as well just get one at the airport and save the cab fare. Also, they charge for internet access. I didn't test it because I have my phone and that was enough to do the small amount of internet surfing I needed to do. I would not stay here for an entire vacation as it's not a very relaxing or beautiful place to hang out, but for a pit stop on the way in or out of Maui it gets the job done. The clientele was quite different from what you would find at a resort, but everyone was nice - unlike some of the reviewers I didn't see what looked like any criminal activity on the grounds. I didn't try the restaurant but it was easy enough to get a pizza delivered.

Reviews.Title: “I would have happily stayed here my whole trip!”
Reviews.Author: Putz_and_me
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night after a long flight before moving to a condo in Kahana. The room was dated but very clean. The shower had good pressure and lots of hot water. The bed and pillows were perfect. This was the best night sleep I had my entire trip in Maui. It is a bit too far from the main vacation hot spots. If it were closer to the great food and beaches of Lahaina I would have moved back to this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Seaside Hotel (Maui done affordably)”
Reviews.Author: shadowlands
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in early September at the Maui Seaside Hotel in Kahului, Maui, Hawaii. It was honestly the best place if on a budget. It's nicely situation in Maui's largest city, close to the airport, the only Wal-Mart on the island, and the gateway to the Road to Hana as well as the volcano. The hotel staff was very accomidating as well. They helped us out endless times. An added bonus to this hotel is just how close it is to shopping centers, gas stations, and eating establishments. You're less than an hour from Maui's famous west coast. It's not a super fancy place. It's a simplistic hotel that's clean. All in all, my wife, baby and myself are happy and please that we selected the Maui Seaside Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: RIVERMAN63
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed here one night - Friday Oct 8th, after landing from a flight to Kahului from LAX via Honolulu -- we arrived late - 11 PM. We were beat. These guys were very nice, courteous, caring and just wonderful. The room was a basic hotel room but it was clean and comfortable and quiet. There is a parking lot on site but we did have to pay $5.00 to park our rental car. They also have an on site security guard. The location is "Local" and not close to the resorts but there is a beach and a nice bay/ocean view. I've posted a few pictures on this site and you will see that the grounds are well maintained and very nice. There is a coffee shop - "Coconut Grille" attached to the hotel and we had breakfast there. The food and service were excellent. This is a good hotel to use as a base location for sight seeing while on the island.

Reviews.Title: “A bit more of what you can get for this price”
Reviews.Author: Davalfher
Reviews.Content: We considered taking a trip to Maui for 3 nights while staying at friend's in Oahu. In our efforts to find affordable quality lodging in Maui, we considered many choices, including several B&B's , and this hotel. But we happened to end up in it due to the Hotwire's Hotdeal: they offered us a extremely attractive price for a hotel in a determined area, around 25-30% cheaper than the cheapest hotel in the island, but without revealing the name of the hotel, just how many starts and some of the service it includes, and an immediate payment is required, and no cancellations accepted. Only after you buy, then they tell you what hotel you paid for. We took the risk and we certainly were not disappointed. Even though the lady that received us at the front desk clearly was in training in her first days of work, backup girls came to help and we were delighted. There was no problem. We were surprised to learn that the rate includes full service breakfast in the restaurant next door, the Coconut Grill. The only downside is they charge $5 parking a day. It's good because they have security agent all night long checking and going around the cars. They offer free parking but across the busy street from the hotel, and no security watch. We just agreed in paying for their parking The grounds were very green and clean, very nicely maintained. Our room, maybe because of the Hotwire deal, was not in the best location: the window was looking directly to the building entrance ramp, and it was a little bit tucked in the ground, but neither of those facts affected our stay. The window was normal size and fully above the ground. What I probably liked the most, is that the room was HUGE, probably the biggest hotel room I've been in. inside the room is also when you notice the hotel is very old, but at the same time, after 3 nights, you notice how much effort and dedication the owners/manager had put in keeping it in extremely good shape. Our room had an area of irregular floor, near the window, but the carpet was pristine on top of it and it didn't affect our comfort either. If you want a microwave, as stated in the hotel webpage, has to arrange it BEFORE your arrival, as well as a hair dryer, you need to ask for it in the front desk. We didn't have the microwave in our room when we arrived, but I called front desk and after less than 10 mins was brought and connected in our room. The hotel is barely 3 or 4 miles from the airport, that is less than 10 mins, and close to all of Kahului, restaurants, convenience stores. Is also an excellent central point in the island to beaches, Haleakala and he Hana road.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great location for exploring all that central Maui has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasview
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed several nights at this hotel in July. My husband was visiting the island for work-related purposes, but we found plenty of time to explore central Maui as well. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful any time we had a question. We were always greeted with a smile by everyone working at the hotel. The grounds were surrounded by very nice local shrubbery. The pool overlooked the ocean and the lobby offered a room with comfy chairs overlooking the pool and ocean. The hotel was a little dated, but I really enjoy the retro feel. My impression was that the hotel had a lot of history and character. The rooms were quite and the beds were super-comfortable. We could see canoe races outside our building, which were exciting to witness when we left the hotel in the morning. The hotel does not offer a fitness center, but the track at the nearby college was open for anyone wanting to run a few laps. There are several restaurants and shopping centers within walking distance, and nice beach parks are just a few minutes away by car. We dined at The Ale House twice, which had good food and drinks at a good value. Ioa Valley State Park, Kepaniwai Heritage Gardens, and The Bailey House are all fun places to visit within a short driving distance. Also, we were treated to 'Ulalena in Lahaina, which is an absolute must-see theatrical performance depicting Maui's history. Also I recommend the Pacific Whale Foundation for sea excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Only stayed one night & that was enough!”
Reviews.Author: corriefan50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maui Seaside after a long flight. Rooms were so outdated. Found worm like insects in the bathroom and bedside table. Didn't want to use the shower. Fridge wasn't working. Didn't want to walk around room with no shoes on. We ate in Coconuts restaurant. Staff there very friendly and food good. Was very glad we were only staying one night. Would not recommend hotel or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like Florida in the 70's, and that's a good thing.”
Reviews.Author: jfsinmsp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for just a night upon arrival in Maui. It reminded me of the little family run hotels in Florida before the chains took over. The rooms are basic and the property is definitely vintage, but what do you expect? If you want the Four Seasons you can go pay for the Four Seasons. We should have stayed longer. It would have been a good place to stay for 2 or 3 nights as a base to see the north side of the island and would have saved a lot of money. No complaints. Services was great too. I even got an "apology" that I had to park off-site, which was approximately a 60 second walk back to the hotel. The restaurant was good too. I recommend putting some of the coconut syrup in your coffee. Very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very clean accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: Ulu-Boy
Reviews.Content: This experience was excellent and comfortable. The accommodations we had is great for families, spacious with a nice kitchenette. I loved the cleanliness and was especially thrilled with the tub drainage. Many Las Vegas hotels do not have the tub drainage and would do well to figure out how Maui Seaside accomplishes this excellent cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Total Retro Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: dracman
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate from Hotels.com, stayed 2 nights. The hotel was like a time capsule, you expected to see a young Elvis strolling on the beach. The hotel is definitely the type I remembered staying at as a youngster in the 60's complete with the lighted coconut trees, vintage pool and white washed walls. Overall the rooms were clean and the staff was helpful. I could see they had a problem with car break in's, security around the lot was pretty tight. They charged us a $5/day parking fee or told us we could take our chances parking for free in the dirt lot next door. We took a look at the lot and saw the glittering jewles of broken glass and decided to pay the $5. The grounds were very well taken care of. Just a note, seaside means that, seaside not oceanside. The beach is actually part of Kahului harbor, so don't expect crashing surf, white sands and a glamorous view, if you want that, book in the resort areas. The water looked clean and there were somepeople swimming, though for what it is, the pool is probably a better option. Very centrally located in Kahului, definitely not the upscale resort destination of the Lahina area, but for a decenbt room for an on the go traveler, a great value for the money. Be advised they charge for everything incvluding internet serivice, but that is to be expected for the budget.

Reviews.Title: “great value for maui”
Reviews.Author: kenji98
Reviews.Content: tthere is a small little beach in the back---but its not the beaxch you really want to see when one visits maui'''i had a great deal which included a car.....it's clean and the staff is fine...maui has plenty to explore than to sit in a hotel so this place was just fine and it was cleanaand quiet.....there's not a lot of traffic and the pool was very clean...if you are looking to spend on a room or resort then this isn't it...i wanted to explore the island and beaches and hardly stayed indoors.....maui can be expensive but i wasn't looking for a big resort and with children that like to go this was fine. there is a laundry room and free coffee in the morning...i've stayed in many places and for the price and deal i got this was a bargain

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Price”
Reviews.Author: airlineman
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to everything. the mall is minutes away with great shops and restaurants. the airport is nearby (less than 10 minutes) the staff was very attentive and professional. the room was large and clean and even came with a refridgerator. this hotel is good for a couple of days. i wouldnt recommend staying longer . they charge for parking wish i find ridiculous. park for free alongside the hotel. ask the front desk staff about the local hawaii dining restaurant, cant remember where it is but it wasnt far away, next to the BMW dealership. the food was awesome and prices were reasonable. i would definitely stay here again and recommend others to stay as well. really had no negatives about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very friendly staff...brings back the "Old Hawaii" feeling.”
Reviews.Author: pliem
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the airport and in the heart of Kahului. Lots of restaurants and places to go...all within walking distance. The pool area is very relaxing. Staff were very friendly. No whistles and bells but very comfortable and clean hotel and well worth the value!

Reviews.Title: “meets needs for price”
Reviews.Author: Ayvah1
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for 2 nights for $210 for 2 nights including taxes and parking fee ($5/night but there is apparently a nearby lot for free). They were having a special price on their website which was lower than the AAA discounted price. They do have a refrigerator and the room is fairly large. Things are basic but they work. They have nearby restaurants and a mall which is nice. They did have a security guard, air conditioning, and a pool here. I felt like my needs were met, and you really can't beat the price. The location is next to the airport and it is a convenient starting point for going on the road to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen luggage”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieCat
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with the attitude of the staff and the effort they made to find a stolen piece of luggage at their hotel. On the day I checked out, I took my luggage to my rental car and placed it in the backseat of my rental at one point. I know I was doing some repositioning of the luggage and may have set it outside the car on the lot. I then with my friend went into the hotel restaurant and had breakfast. We left and went two more places to sight-see on our last day. The doors had been locked at these locations, however, when I got to the car return location, my luggage was missing. The only place that it had been vulnerable was at the hotel. I called the front desk and they said they would check the premises, but after only a minute she came back to the line to say no one turned it in. I asked if she would check the parking lot and she said she had. I hastily returned to the hotel from the airport and talked to staff and security and no one claimed to have seen the bag. I asked if they would talk to the day shift employees and call me with their findings. I left my phone #. I flew out that evening and didn't hear another word. I called later the next day and was told by the front desk, no one had turned in any luggage. I asked her and the manager and their canned response was "no one turned anything in". I am concerned by the lack of concern or interest in trying to assist. In fact, one of the front desk attendants seemed to be totally uninterested.
