The motel has a security guard on site that was within sight of our car, but I don't think that there was any attention paid to what may have been going on inside or outside of my car. I take full responsibility for putting my bag at risk, but I was very dissatisfied with the effort and concern for their guest and the stolen property. The bag was full of souvenirs totalling at least $200. I will never go back to this hotel for the simple fact that the security appears to be lacking along with any reasonable concern by their employees for their customers belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for One Night”
Reviews.Author: Susan_Powers_2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed by myself at the Maui Seaside Hotel the evening of March 5, 2010 after arriving tired from a long flight from the mainland. Booked the hotel in advance. I traveled to Maui to visit a friend who lives in Lahaina, so just needed a room for one night. When I arrived, the staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The room was very large, had a partial view of the ocean and I was able to see my rental car in the parking area they told me to park in. It was quiet at night after the children left the pool area at dusk and made for a good night's rest. Their parking lot was full that evening, but the place they told me to park was okay and the car secure. There is a restaurant next door called Coconuts. I did not eat there - just wanted a glass to milk to go - but the food coming out of the kitchen looked amazing - very upscale and large portions - smelled good too. Saturday morning I went to the Maui Swap Meet. This is not your typical swap meet. It is very upscale, more like an arts and crafts market, with mabe' pearl necklaces, pareos, sarongs, fresh squeeded fruit juices, amazing jewelry and art. The ideal place to stop for souvenirs and stuff to wear on the island. I would stay the night again at the Maui Seaside Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: natallycat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui on a reward trip from his company. We decided to fly in a night early so we could get in some sleep and get on the different time schedule. We picked this place based on its proximity to the airport. I was so freaked out when we got there! Our cab driver told us not to stay there but we didn't think it would be as bad as it was. I swear they must be running a drug ring or a prostitution ring out out of that place. The whole night we heard loud sounds and bangs on the walls. The thing is it that they advertise well on the internet. It is also not in a bad part of town. I don't think there is such a thing as a "bad part of town" in Maui. Anyways, we left the hotel at like 8 am and got a cab to our hotel at the Fairmont in Waliea. When we arrived at the Fairmont and saw our faces on of the staff immediately asked if we made the "common" mistake of staying at the Maui Seaside. I couldn't believe they knew without us telling them!

Reviews.Title: “I booked a 14 night stay at the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Kbarboza808
Reviews.Content: I booked a 14 night stay at the hotel during a business trip and the staff was so warm and friendly that I felt like I was at home! They had the true Hawaii spirit and showed me so much Aloha that I will ONLY stay at the Maui Seaside hotel going forward while I'm on business on Maui. The hotel is not the most modern hotel but Is very CLEAN and sits right on the ocean and is centrally located right near the malls wholefoods and the airport. This hotel has everything that is needed if our traveling on business or on a family vacation. They also provideded me with a microwave, coffee maker and refridge so I could eat in after a long day of work. I highly recommend this hotel if you really want to experience the true hawaiian hospitaliy that the islands have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: jorn
Reviews.Content: This place is OK, if you have nowhere else to stay. Unfriendly, arrogant and demining front desk personnel. I didnâ€™t feel that I was welcome at this place at all. My biggest complains is absolutely the weird and unfriendly front desk staff and the noise from the street. This hotel ( old motel? ? ) has large rooms with nice beds. But almost EVERYTHING is outdated and should have been demolished or â€œre-inventedâ€� many years ago. The noise from the street is unacceptable. I only slept for a few hours. If that donâ€™t bother you, the location is good at the very ocean front and close to airport. I paid about 132$, and thatâ€™s way overpriced for what you get. Not sufficient facilities in the room. No Coffee / tea facilities, no iron, no hairdryer.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-range motel, in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Low-budget-Chuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Seaside because it was one of the few reasonably-priced hotels on Maui. It looks like, and feels like, a mid-priced motel in the US or Canada. It's very convenient to the airport and shopping -- there's a large fashion mall within walking distance, and many local restaurants. The rooms are rather small, and WiFi costs about $25/week. Parking on their lot is an extra $5/day. We did get a microwave and small fridge. It has a large pool and small beach, which is part of the protected Kahului bay. There's a restaurant on the property, which we never ate at. If you expect an all-inclusive resort, you'll be disappointed in the Maui Seaside. We wanted somewhere to sleep, and store our stuff, while we explored Maui, and we were well satisfied. Charles

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Lunasolhk
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed for 2 nights. We pick this Hotel as its close to Airport (we are leaving quite early an its just a 10 to 15 mins drive to airport) plus we need to wake up early for sunrise from Haleakala (which we just use slightly more than 1 hours to arrive the visitor centre). the rooms are ok althoguh they are a bit old. there are 2 big shopping mall next to the hotel so no problem with food. Parking is cheap too!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money.”
Reviews.Author: questiononmaui
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a little worried about booking this hotel, but my husband and I simply did not have a choice with our budget. The place was clean, spacious, and there were no bugs. The staff was pleasant and the location was central to going everywhere which is what we wanted to do. It was definately worth the price. The only thing that annoyed me was we specifically ordered a room with a king size bed, paid extra in fact for a king sized bed, and when we got there we were told they were sold out and they only had two double beds. The rest was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: phxdale
Reviews.Content: I found the room to be adequate for our needs. We were upgraded to a larger room by doing a price match with them directly(see their website). Everything is very simple and basic. We didn't spend much time in the room. The beach is accessible but only from the main pool area/courtyard. This is definitely not a resort. Its an inexpensive hotel to sleep in. I did find the location to be great for exploring both sides of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: sleepingdogusa
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminded me of the flea bag hotels I would see around bus stations. I've stayed at better hotels at truck stops. It's the type of hotel that if you were looking for a hotel to stay in and you drove by the Maui Seaside, you'd keep driving. Staying with a tour group we had little choice of where we were staying. Frankly YMT Tours should be ashamed of themselves for booking their groups at this hotel. Every time I think about sleeping in this hotel, I cringe. As my mother would say: "this is not a hotel where a respectable lady would stay". Once again, mother knows best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel/location for the money”
Reviews.Author: Fox7777
Reviews.Content: We had a very good time here, rooms were very clean, nice and it is an ideal central location to discover the island. It is owned by Hawaiians and there are local Hawaiian options on the breakfast menu at a reasonable price. The Hideaway is a nice beachfront restaurant just East of the hotel on the other side of the outrigger canoes. This is like an upscale Motel 6 but there is a nice beach, pool and the considerable money you save allows you to do more traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, affordable, clean & comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: petluvrmn
Reviews.Content: The staff was attentive, friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable -- it was certainly not the Ritz, but for the price, I felt it was a great deal! The pool was clean and well-kept. It's location was ideal for exploring the capital city, and the location of the hotel was ideal for catching almost any highway out of town! The hotel is not on a beach where you would swim, it's on a cove on the inside of the island. It's not as warm as it is on the western side of the island, and the sun isn't necessarily shining as much as it would be in Lahaina, but we were treated to watching many wind surfers and native rowing groups while lounging at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great locally owned hotel with much Aloha”
Reviews.Author: Beoblorf
Reviews.Content: For the price, the Maui Seaside Hotel can't be beat as a discount hotel for a longer term stay (rent a car and take advantage of its central location) or for a one night stay when you first arrive or fly home. Our room was on a high floor with a king bed facing the ocean, exactly as requested and we were checked in by pleasent and helpful staff which is nice after a 13 hour journey. While it is an older hotel, they do an excellent job of maintaining the grounds in an impeccable manner and the room and hallways, while looking a bit dated, were always very clean and well kept. The bed was very comfortable, the sheets and bedcover were new and colourful and the room was very large with a table and chairs along with the king sized bed. This is a locally owned hotel with a lot of Hawaiian Aloha spirit and was a pleasure to stay at. The restaurant is also very good with friendly service and great food - especially after a 13 hour journey. The pasta dishes are huge and can easily be split and the breakfast menu has plenty of tempting choices and both of our breakfasts were hot and delicious. For such a low rate I wasn't expecting much, but the Maui Seaside Hotel exceeded my expectations which is why I'm writing this review - something I don't usually do.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to stay at Maui on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: keli486
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant about this hotel after seeing some bad reviews elsewhere, however we wanted to go to Maui and could not afford an extravagant resort. Also, we just wanted a hotel to shower and sleep that was located in a central part of the island so we could easily access every part of Maui. The Maui Seaside Hotel was perfect for us! They automatically upgraded us to a room with a view of the courtyard/ocean when we arrived, since we were staying for 11 nights (not sure if this is normal, but was nice for us). The hotel was quiet, clean, and in our price range. If we ever go back to Maui (and we still aren't rich), we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In need of an update”
Reviews.Author: Sun-seekerNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 2 nights here. The room was clean and large, but the furniture and beds are old. I would not stay here more than a few nights. The air condition was really loud, but worked ok. Friendly and helpful staff. Close to the mall which is just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Quiet, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: timuralex
Reviews.Content: This 3-story small hotel is located 15-min drive from the Kahului airport and very close to the Queen Kaahumanu Shopping Mall and the Kahului harbor. The location is also perfect if you have no car and have to rely on Maui bus, which stops at the Mall. The personnel is very friendly and attentive to your requests. Very quiet and countyside-alike atmosphere. No complimentary breakfasts but the Mall and other shops nearby are always good alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price”
Reviews.Author: salilsurendran
Reviews.Content: After being ripped off in Honolulu by Castle Sky Maile, I expected the Maui Seaside Hotel to be a dumpster. I was pleasantly surprised. For $66 a night I got a nice double bed room which was clean and tidy. The only problem being the AC in the room doesn't seem to cool as much maybe because the room is big.

Reviews.Title: “No Honeymooners here!”
Reviews.Author: candied
Reviews.Content: While the hotel location was great for a quick ride to the airport, this hotel is not a multiple night stay or family friendly. I traveled with my husband and 2 daughters (ages 15 and 9). The beds were small and uncomfortable. The bathroom - very basic! Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly place to stay with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: mauiboyatheart
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel previously and have always had great stays and experienced the very friendly and wonderful staff there. On this particular visit we had our toothpaste confiscated by TSA due to the tube size being too big, our fault. It was 10:30pm when we pulled up to Longs Drugs only to see a closed sign on the door. Well, let's go to the hotel, check in and ask where else we could go to get some toothpaste. When we asked, while checking in, 'Keiki' handed us a little tube of toothpaste and said, "If you don't mind the brand, you can have this one." with a great warm smile. That just made our whole stay. On top of that, the next morning the wife realized she didn't bring her hair dryer so we called the front desk to check if we could rent one. "No charge, we'll have one delivered to your room." was the warm reply from the front desk. There are always warm friendly greetings whereever you go in this hotel. The stays are always too short and this hotel is truly 'NO KA OI' on Maui. Mr and Mrs Ramsay Morisaki

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, basic hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Tri-addict
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were flying to Kona and had to stop in Maui for the night. We needed an inexpensive hotel close to OGG airport. This was perfect. Only 2 miles from the airport, a $12 taxi ride, and $90/night. The staff was very friendly but the hotel wasn't that nice. You get what you pay for. It's like the Motel 6 of Maui. The rooms were very basic: air conditioning unit in the corner, ceiling fan, and refrigerator unplugged. They had no coffee maker or hairdryer. However they did serve coffee in the lobby, but only from 5-7 am. So to get your coffee fix, you'll need to be an early riser...or go across the street to burger king or Ihop. The hotel was next to the ocean, but there wasn't really a beach. This hotel is fine if you're looking for somewhere to stay near the airport at the beginning or end of your trip. I wouldn't spend more than one night there. But it met our purpose and I would consider staying here again if we need a place near OGG for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Aimster77
Reviews.Content: We had a 9 o'clock pm flight so we got a room at the Maui Seaside to nap, hang out and freshen up before our flight. The staff is friendly. The hotel is Hawaiian owned which made me feel good. The room was a little dated in its appearance. They had just changed from keys to key cards the day we arrived. The room had an old fashioned telephone and no alarm clock. No big deal as we called the front desk to ask for a wake up call, and they did. The room had a fridge which was nice. The room was clean but seemed a little dreary because of the outdated fixtures. I didn't use the pool but I noticed it at check in. Looked nice. One little complaint-- they charged me for parking. That seemed odd as this was a more like a motel than a hotel.... It was only 5 bucks though so not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: Lolomayani
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Maui for a Church Occasion during the weekend. We were very pleased with the Aloha Spirit that was with the agents upon check in. Rooms are clean. Very quiet . Deluxe rooms with 3beds is good enough for families with children . Microwave and Refrigerator. The location is very convenient for everything. Shopping, Rental Cars, Airport etc. We were very pleased with everything.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Maui Gem”
Reviews.Author: officeasst
Reviews.Content: Would like to comment on the gracious and friendly gals at the check -in counter. This little hotel is a gem, located in Kahului, Maui, a great starting point for visiting Maui! Maui Seaside has a wonderful, warm local ambience. The rooms are clean, the grounds are lovely, and the 'Coconut Grill' serves delicious meals, especially the Friday Prime Rib Dinner...for $19.95!! Our group lives in Honlulu, so the hotel really felt 'like home', lots of 'Aloha' on the part of the staff. Best of all, the shower was like Akaka Falls!!! A full, steamy hot shower after a great day of golf! Perfect little gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Room with 3 beds :) and a crib”
Reviews.Author: melsamom
Reviews.Content: My husband and my three children recently returned from Maui after attending a wedding and we were anxious to relax and have the baby take a nap. We were really pleased to have rooms with 3 separate beds and a moderately sized crib. The baby was able to sleep while the older children watched the waves and played in the well-kept lawn. The hotel is conveniently located to the airport, shopping centers, starbucks coffee, and other places of interest. The Coconut Grill Restaurant located at the hotel was excellent and child-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIC EXPERIENCE! ROACHES, TERMITES, RUDE STAFF.”
Reviews.Author: LuvTheSun001
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I checked into this hotel on a Sunday. The following day, we returned to our room (at 9:00 pm) after a day outing only to find dozens of TERMITES and COCKROACHES all over our room. When we called the front desk, we were informed that they would give us another room. Fine. This next room was in the same condition, if not worse. My boyfriend literally filmed a roach climbing on our bed for 10 minutes while we were waiting for the staff to do SOMETHING. We were shown two more rooms, only to be met with the same conditions, as well as tons of HAIR UNDER THE BEDSPREAD AND SHEETS! All of this we meticulously videotaped as we couldn't believe what was happening! I asked to speak to a manager but was rudely informed by the two women at the front desk that they make the decisions when the manager is away, and that it is too late to call the manager. At this point, the two women at the front desk stated that they would not show us any other rooms because we are "looking to find something"- when we were merely lifting the sheets on the besd to check for more insects and hair! This went on for hours until I decided to call the local police, who informed us that it wasn't there concern. After speaking to the police, it was around midnight and my boyfriend and I were asking to be shown ONE clean room in which we could spend the night in until we could check out the following morning. It was obviously the middle of the night and the hotel is in a seedy area of town so we did not love the idea of leaving and having to find something at that hour. Additionally, we prepaid our entire 9 day stay and were concerned we would not be refunded. The two front desk women ignored us, made unbelievably rude and sarcastic comments, and finally checked us out and had security take out our luggage out of our room WITHOUT OUR CONSENT. Again, we videtoaped this entire incident. We wanted nothing more than a clean room to stay in until morning so we could check out and were met with nothing but hostility and rudeness- not even one apology for the state of the rooms, nothing of the sort. One of the women at the front desk called the police to have us removed from the premises, and this was done for no reason at all as we did not do anything except ask for a clean room. We videotaped our entire exchange with the staff, as their behavior was absolutely unbelievable (even when they knew they were being videotaped!!!!)! At around 1:00 am we were thrown out of the hotel and forced to find another room in a city we were not familiar with and at the height of the tourist season. Upon returning home, I received a letter of apology from the owner stating that insects are normal in a tropical climate (however, he conveniently did not mention the globs of hair under the sheets -which have NOTHING to do with the climate, nor did he mention the rude and unhelpful staff)- I'm sorry but it is NOT OK for a hotel to have termites and cockroaches in the rooms, no matter what the climate. And it is not OK for hotel staff to mock you and complain that you are being crazy for checking under the sheets on your bed! We have stayed in Hawaii twice previously and never had this problem with insects. Also, the hotel we checked in afterwards did not have any such insect problems. Stay far far away! Save your money, and, more importantly, your time and patience.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Travel Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: BudgetGirl101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was great. We were son a tight budget and knew we weren't going to spend a lot of time at the Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised by this place. It was an older place but the beds were comfortable and room was clean. It really felt like we were the only people there but the place was all full. It is kind of a ways from anything but we had a car so that worked for us fine. We left on a red eye and were told that the hotel offered a hospitality room so you could freshenup before your flight. This was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and inexpensive, but not a place to hang out”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: The good: friendly reception; close to airport, close to Maui Mall, Kahului Mall, Kaahumanu Mall, Iao Valley; inexpensive; my room had a water view and I could sleep to the sound of the waves. The bad: dated, dark rooms, mildewy bathrooms (mine had bits of sand on the floor). This is okay if you need a cheap place to sleep, but you will not want to spend any time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: crankyrabbit
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pretty small, and the pool is tiny. Other than that, we had no complaints -- the front desk was happy to answer our questions and give recommendations for restaurants and activities. Our room was fairly clean, though the whole place could use some new carpet. It was worth the money, especially if you're not going to be staying in the rooms for long. The restaurant on the property was a decent one, though a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “budget accomodation-decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: musiqueetcirque
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for one night because our condo wasn't ready until the next night. We arrived right at check in time 3pm, and I had booked the cheapest room. We paid about $95 for the room, it was a basic motel room, like a motel 6. It was clean apart from the dingy carpet, that was so old and almost sticky. It had a nasty smell of too many cleaning supplies or deodorants to mask the smell of the old carpets I'm assuming. The beds were comfortable though, hotel staff were very friendly, (apart from the front desk staff)... the pool was very clean and nice, and there is a nice beach as well. All in all, it was fine considering the price and it allowed us to go to costco the next morning and pick up groceries before heading to west Maui. They have wireless internet but you have to pay for it. $9.99 / hour or $20 for the day I think. Parking was $5 unless you wanted to park somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For First Night....”
Reviews.Author: middietraveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to use the Maui Seaside Hotel as a vacation destination I can recommend a gazillion other options on the island that will give you more bang for your buck....That said, my wife and I are from Ohio and our flight didn't arrive until late at night....after a loooong day of flying, a lengthy layover at LAX, all we wanted was a bed, shower, roof over our head within a stone's throw of the airport. Maui Seaside fit the bill and my wife's degree is in zoology so a bug here and there (we actually saw none) wouldn't have been a deal-breaker. Our room was fine. I recommend this hotel simply as a short stay "crash pad" on your first or last night in Maui if you just want to be close to the airport....

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: alohomora
Reviews.Content: Yes, I know Hawaii has cockroaches. BUT THEY SHOULD NOT BE IN YOUR HOTEL BED!!! And this one was giant, almost two inches. We saw one of his smaller friends earlier on the curtain, and who knows how many more of their buddies were lurking around. Needless to say, we got the hell out of there. The last thing I needed was some cockroach imbedding itself in my ear canal. We slept in our rental car that night, which was more preferable than sleeping with cockroaches. Oh, the hotel, don't stay there, don't even stay in Kahului. Aside from the rather awesome movie theater, there is really nothing there except big box stores. We ended up in Lahaina and loved every minute of it. A really authentic experience over there, with great restaurants and shops, and tons of local artists. And, of course, awesome beaches. It turned out to be a really fabulous trip. Don't let the Maui Seaside Hotel ruin your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is in the industrial area of town....”
Reviews.Author: jenschiefs
Reviews.Content: Never been to Maui, so that may be my fault. But this hotel is really not near anything. But with a rental car, you can drive anywhere obviously. It is a very quiet motel to stay at. No real beach though. The pool area is very relaxing. The rooms are spacious and clean! THe ladies at the front desk are awesome! They were very helpful in giving us directions. We had to check out by noon, but our flight didn't leave until 6:30pm. The hotel staff stored our bags all day for us, while we spent the day at the beach! We came back before our flight, laid out at the pool and then used the hospitality room that they offer. It was pretty nice. They do have a restaurant, but it was very expensive. We didn't try it. Someone posted before that they lock up the parking lot at night with a gate..not true. they do have security...even though we left one morning at 3:30AM, they were no where to be found. All in all, great price for a room to sleep and shower. I don't understand having to pay an exorbitant amount of money for that.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: The_Choates
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and after i read the reviews i was kinda nervous about staying there. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly security/parking guy. Off to a good start, we checked in quite late and it was very quiet around the hotel, ( no undesirables throughout our stay) You do pay to park, but thats ok. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was clean, yes it needs some updates, but still very clean and everything worked, the towels were full size!!!!, we stayed there for 8 days and we enjoyed it. It does have a harbor next to it but you do have a small private beach area, always very quiet. Room service was great, even folded some of our clothes that were on the bed. If your looking for a hip resort type hotel, this is not for you, if you want a good price and a nice quiet friendly place, this is it, We never once saw any icky locals throughout our stay, we were upgraded to a deluxe room, which was in the tower, nice big size room, the only thing that i could say is there is no coffee pot in the room, you have to request one, if they have one you can get it, they now serve coffee between 5am and 7am, thats it, once its gone, its gone, so if your like me and like lots of coffee, get a coffee pot, no food other than the resteraunt, which is a little on the higher side, but very good food. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good for arrival night”
Reviews.Author: aBadgerandaGopher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Seaside for one night in January 2009. We used the place for our first night on the island rather than going straight to our condo. This worked quite well for us, as we were tired and the Maui Seaside was quite easy to find and get to from the airport. The rooms are standard family class hotel with a small fridge. Our room was clean, but did have a slight musty smell. Theyâ€™re saving energy and it was closed up without the AC running. The property has a nice garden area in the center with the swimming pool. There is a little beach out back, which made for a couple of pleasant strolls. We had breakfast at their Coconut Grill Restaurant and it was quite good. They do charge $5 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place!”
Reviews.Author: MyMauiBoston
Reviews.Content: Not expecting anything, as I have driven past this hotel 1000 times, I found myself in need of a clean place to stay for a few nights. Much to my delight, I found this family-owned hotel quaint and the staff could not be friendlier. I love the idea of being able to keep my windows open all night to listen to the ocean (who needs AC??? If you do, they have window units.) The pool area looked well maintained and inviting, and you can go into the ocean there, but I would not recommend it in the afternoon after the wind picks up. Right next door there is a nice little local beach. If you want a clean place to stay, conveinient to most everything on Maui, you can't beat this place. Breakfast in the restaurant was pretty good, as well (you have to go get your own food, no room service.) Yeah, I agree, the towells are small, but I loved the little refrigerators. I love the vegitation on and around the hotel property. It looks (& is,) natural to the islands and it feels like going back in time a bit, which I find inviting. One afternoon there were local musicians practicing in the seats in the lobby area, which also added to the island feel. I also agree with the Costco comment - all Maui roads lead to Costco! Don't stay on this island long without shopping there. Also, the Saturday Swap Meet has moved to the Maui Community College campus, which is close to the Maui Seaside. This is a great place to pick up some gifts and fresh fruits and veggies.

Reviews.Title: “Quality varies? Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: DisneyPassholder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Seaside for one night. We did not have a hotel reservation upon arrival in Maui. We had lots of weather related issues that held us up in Seattle for over a day, and when we finally were able to get on a plane to HI, we did not have time to make a reservation. The person helping us at Thrifty Car Rental had a couple of suggestions, since it was our first time ever in HI, we decided to try to stay the first night at the closest place by the airport since it was really late. He called Seaside and I overheard him say something when talking to them about them only having a room available in the old area of the hotel, that should have been my warning ... The good: Close to airport; Low cost for room. The bad: Apparently some room conditions are worse than others. We were in a room that appeared to be very old and run down. My wife was afraid.... We also had to park in overflow parking area as I saw mentioned in another review. This overflow parking area was by a community park of some sort where there were drunks in their parked cars. The morning after our stay, when we went to our car, we witnessed one of these people get out of their car and relieve themselves right on the ground by their car. Summary: Sounds like some people have had better luck here, they must have been in a newer room than we had. If you can afford a little more cost, and the distance, I would highly recommend you consider going to the Maui Coast instead. We stayed there the next two nights and were very pleased. Will try to write a review of that stay also.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be better, but still a good value”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Maui Seaside several times over the last 30 years, and we have always found it to be a good deal. Now the actual costs are escalating, perhaps because Maui Seaside is the only decent hotel in Kahului. It has always been a no-frills hotel: no microwave. small thin towels, no Internet in either the rooms or the lobby, but local calls are free if you want to use dial-up and you have an Internet Service Provider. The refrigerator had a good freezing compartment that froze our ice pack. Maui Seaside has a restaurant now. Even with the discount for guests, the prices appeared on the high side. We noticed one dining room was reserved for a tour group, and we wondered if the restaurant was established mainly for tour groups. Perhaps because of the new restaurant, the complimentary breakfast and parking are no longer included in the room rate. There was an additional $5 for parking. The reception desk staff are very cheerful, relaxed, and helpful, as always, as are the new staff who have to allocate parking between patrons of both the restaurant and the hotel. We picked up some good things at the Sunday (no longer Saturday) swap meet on the grounds of the community college, not far from Maui Seaside. We appreciate that they did not raise their room rate during peak season, beginning in late December. Maui Seaside is still the best hotel deal in Kahului, but Maui is small, so next time we probably would stay in an upcountry hotel that offers better services and provides easy access to the rest of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad bad!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hagen
Reviews.Content: We, as others, arrived late into the Maui Airport so decided to stay near the hotel and then go to our condo in Lahina the next day. BIG mistake....The hotel is (we believe) a hub for drug dealing...several young men milling about, a little scary. We put a chair in front our door for added security. There is a security guard there all night and they "Bolt" the front gate at night. You could see through the towels and they were the size of a regular hand towel. No hairdryer. OLD window type air conditioner that rattled all night! We paid extra for an Ocean view...BIG mistake! The hotel is on an ugly bay and there are NO rooms with a view from the inside. The beds were so uncomfortable with springs showing in one of our beds....You have to pay for parking which wraps around another building and can be a far walk....stupid! In the morning we couldn't get out of there fast enough!!! Unfortunately there aren't any good hotels near the airport..(Embassy Suites could make a killing in this area of Maui). If we had to do it again we would have hired a car to take us across the island and then rent a car the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fits the prise”
Reviews.Author: Unknown78
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Seaside hotel for 7 days. When we first got there we were told that parking by the hotel was $5 but that there was also a free parking lot behind the hotel. We saw a lot of cars parked at the free lot the first night, so we parked there too. The parking was safe during our stay. The room was cleaned every day but one day when we came back we found hair on the white sheet on the bed. We did not use this sheet before. So, I am not sure if it was changed from last time it was rented or not. We could not find any nice beaches around Seaside hotel. So, almost every day we drove to West Maui ( Lahaina, Kapalua ) beaches. This is about 30 mn drive from Seaside. If you are really looking to be by the beach Seaside is probably not the hotel you want to rent. There are shops and malls around this hotel but nothing more to see. I am not sure if you could go for a nice walk there at night. If you want to get out at night, take a walk, buy gifts then go to Lahaina. We ate at Kimo's restaurant. It is not cheap but they have fresh fish and the steak was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “great for first and last nite”
Reviews.Author: izmocars
Reviews.Content: this hotel is PERFECT for when you arrive in MAUI for example we arrived at 745 pm and was exhausted -it was great place to rest before heading out to the 5 star resort ( i figured when we were tired -jet lagged why pay $375 for one night when i could pay 100) anyways room was small but clean and perfect for a good nights sleep- in fact on our last day in Maui seeing that our plane departed at 1145 pm i decided to check into the hotel that morning on the day we left - this gave us some time shopping , some more hawaii time and a perfect place to shower and nap before heading to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Unhappy077
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservations 7 months before our stay, their website said there was a complimentary breakfast each morning on the veranda. That was a major reason we chose that hotel. When we arrived, I asked about the breakfast and was told they now had a restaurant. There was nothing on their website about having to pay for parking, but when we got there, we were charged $5/day to park in their lot. Our first night was uneventful, but on our second night, we returned to our room to find water dripping from the ceiling. We called the Front Desk and after about 30 minutes, we were switched to another room. We finally got moved in and then saw that there were termites swarming around the light. We killed about 20 before we called again. She said our room was the first this season to have termites. So, we got moved again. Our evening was taken up moving out of and into rooms instead of seeing Maui. I asked if we would be compensated for all the trouble, and she said she would "comp" us one night. If I had not asked, we no doubt would have paid the full rate for that night.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: CathyinPhoenix
Reviews.Content: This is just what we needed. We had a late flight and we needed a place to stay before we went to the condo. It was perfect for us. By staying in Kahaluli overnight we were able to get up refreshed in the morning and head over to Costco before our vacation began.(a little note on Costco. The prices are close to what they are on the main land and a whole lot less than the local stores like Safeway and Star Mart. So trust me on this just buy your items at Costco.) It is a older motel, but clean and kept up. We had a decent bed and good pillow. There was even a small fridge, but you have to turn it on. It did get cold quickly. You won't be disappointed with the place, although I don't know why they charge $5 for parking, I think it is just one more way to make some money. Looked to me like they had enough places. I mean come on when they build the place in the 60's or whenever it was I am sure they allowed one space for each room. This is not a new concept. So know going in what it is and you will be fine,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Basic Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: rosered78
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an affordable place in Maui for the week and this hotel was in a good location at a great price. The rooms were very basic, but that was all we needed. We were only at the hotel to shower and sleep. The staff was friendly and very helpful when we had questions. The neighborhood is safe and has several convenience/drug stores, although it is not located on the tourist part of the island, it is not a long drive to Lahaina and front street which we LOVED. Parking was a little inconvenient because there was a side lot and a back lot that were kind of far from our room, but we were able to unload our luggage right in front before we had to park. We enjoyed our stay at the Maui Seaside.

Reviews.Title: “good for the one night needed”
Reviews.Author: snugglebunnies
Reviews.Content: We arranged to stay here for the one night before moving on to our nicer plans. That being said, it's clean and fine for a night's sleep. I was not impressed, however, with paid parking. Yes, it was only $4, but the idea was just plain dumb for approx. 20 parking spaces and three driving/security guards to make sure they park correctly. You don't have to park there, of course. You can walk all your luggage down 1/4 a mile over a semi-sidewalk and grass. The other thing that completely blew me away was that the pool shuts down at SIX in the EVENING! Yes, there is the ocean (with not safe swimming near), but wow! Would I stay again? Yes....for a clean place and a night's rest. I would never suggest anyone experience Hawaii by spending their trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: puggers_mom
Reviews.Content: Although you're always warned ... "you get what you pay for" I thought this hotel was great for our purpose. We had a late late night flight, had to check out of our Ka'anapali beach resort early and wanted somewhere to rest, shower and walk the beaches one last time before heading for the frozen tundra. I have already booked another room for next February when we return to our beloved Island of Maui. Our experience was great, the staff was wonderful and warm. The bathrooms are a bit small, they could add an extra towel or two for showering, but if that's the worse thing that came out of our experience at this hotel, I'd say it's minor. P.S. They WILL NOT give you your keys prior to 3:00 p.m., so if you think you can move from your resort @ 11:00 a.m., and make the drive to Kahului and expect to get in your room, you've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “EWWWWWWWW! Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: val2val
Reviews.Content: We had an early morning flight so booked here just for the night. Upon entering the parking lot, there were at least 4 people directing traffic to remote areas on the property even before we checked in! We had to leave our luggage in the car which, felt very unsafe. The lighting was horrible and there appeared to be no security. Once we walked what felt like forever, checked in and then began our "trek" to find our room. It was exhausting. Once in the room, we decided it was so unbearable that we did not even sit down before calling it quits and returned to the airport and roll the dice for a standby flight home. When we went to leave, the closest exits had been locked so it was a return to the car via the same way we entered, about a 1/2 mile walk. The building is old, dirty, smelly, moldy and anything else you could think of that describes: rat-hole. That and they charged $4.00 for that absurd parking. The desk personnel was friendly enough but that was all I can say good about the place. Cheap is cheap. This place gives new meaning to "you get what you pay for". Next time we will sleep at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “good value, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCharley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice - one night upon arrival and then again for two nights at the end of our stay. This hotel is what you pay for - a basic, cheap motel that is clean but dated. It was a great option for us as the price was right and we only used it as a place to sleep. The fact that the pool was always closed didn't bother us because we would not have used it anyway. The service on the first stay was fine, but the second time we were a little disappointed. We were traveling with our infant daughter and had requested a queen size bed when booking as she was sleeping between us. The first time this request was met, but the second time is wasn't (we were given a room with two doubles). After requesting to switch the desk clerk was quite rude. I accepted her response that my request was only a request, not a guarantee. I asked if they had cribs available instead, and though they did, she was unable to get me one because the housekeeping staff were not on at night. However I had just checked in and there were four women at the front desk.This was the younger woman (I guess this is family run?), and though she was very rude and unhelpful, the older women and housekeeping staff were much friendlier. We did not get a crib as she did not feel it was her job. Rather than get into an argument we just left it at that and made do. I would still stay there again on the way in and out of Maui, but I would request a crib ahead of time and not count on great service. Of course it is worth staying here for the price alone if you plan to spend your day traveling elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Drive On”
Reviews.Author: azazaz
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in Maui at 10:30 PM we thought it best to stay in Kahului vs driving into Kaanapali so we chose one of the only 2 places in Kahului. It was like being at a motel we would stay as kids when on vacation-cheap but fairly clean. We felt like we had gone back to the '50's. we were so tired this first night we didn't notice how tired and dirty this place is. On our return because our flight didn't leave until almost midnight and we had to check out of our condo in Kaanapali at 11:00 we chose to stay again at Maui Seaside just to rest and get ready for the flight home - no overnight, just a dayroom to relax before the flight but we paid as if we were staying the night. The staff was the most unfriendly and unaccommodating I've ever experienced. We arrived at 1:30 only to be told we couldn't check in until 3:00 - the parking lot was basically empty. So we sat in the lobby and waited until 2:30 and asked if "any" rooms were ready. Nope, you have to wait until 3:00. So, at 3:00 my husband asked if the room was ready and they told us they'd put us in the "tower". Well, the tower is at the back of the bus, 3 story unit which stunk to high heaven. I think they did this on purpose because there were other rooms available. I was so glad to get out of this hotel! Parking is a nightmare once everyone arrives and you could end up walking a half a mile just to park!!!!!! Not much choice though in Kahului...deal with the mold and nasty interiors or drive on to your destination which is what we'll do next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Clown_Guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Seaside on three separate occasions for one day each time in January and February. We found each room to be clean and fairly good sized. The staff was always very friendly including the housekeeping and grounds keeper. They always smiled, waved and offered to help out even when not asked. The first stop, we were upgraded to a pool side room. The second two times, we requested early check in and were able to do it. The last day, we had a late flight (11:45pm). We asked if we could keep our suitcases at the hotel, so we wouldnâ€™t have to lug them around with us all day. Not only did they let us leave our luggage in their storage room, they also provided us a small room so we could freshen up before our long flight. That was greatly appreciated. The location of the hotel is right on the ocean with a very nice view of the ocean, the mountains and Iao Valley. It is located close to shopping and restaurants. While we were there, the onsite restaurant was closed. Each morning they provided a continental breakfast of fruit, baked goods, coffee and juice. Depending on the time you got there, you might have a short wait in line. There was limited seating available inside, but we preferred to eat by the pool. This hotel is used by Your Man Tours when they are on the Island, as are the Seaside Hotels on the Big Island. When a tour group is there, upgrades are non existent, parking is tight and lines for breakfast are longer. We did not notice any noise from either outside the room or from adjoining rooms in the evening. We got a great night sleep each time. This is our second time staying at Maui Seaside (we were with Yours Man Tours three years ago). Each time we had a pleasant stay. The hotel is very reasonably priced and after searching for internet coupons were able to find a site to knock off $10+ per night. You just must remember you get what you pay for. We are not ones to sit around, sun ourselves and expect to be waited on. We are out hiking, snorkeling or just enjoying the sites. We leave early in the morning and return at night. For the price, this is the perfect place for us. We would recommend it to anyone who wants a reasonable place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: slattekm
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was hesitant to book this place. But, it was the only thing on Maui in our budget. It was actually very nice. We got a "deluxe room," which was right by the pool and from our little lanai we could see the ocean. It was much better than expected. I would recommend, as long as you are not expecting a luxurious resort!

Reviews.Title: “Convienent and Basic for One Night”
Reviews.Author: toxypharmgirl
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed one night after getting in on a late flight that arrived around ten o'clock. After reading the reviews I was pretty scared to see what we were in for but the room ended up being clean and basic which was what we were looking for. Had an okay view in the morning but checked out right away so didn't really matter. The staff were friendly enough--would not say overly friendly but did their job fine. Went for a late night snack at The Ale House down the street which was perfect. The room is very basic with dated amenities but was clean. Would stay again for one night but would find other accommodations if wanting to make this your vacation getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a cheap quick one night stay”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaNellie
Reviews.Content: The Maui Seaside is good, cheap place to stay if you are landing later in the day and just need a close, clean place to stay before heading to other areas of Maui. When we got there, the desk service staff was very friendly and had upgraded our room. There was plenty of parking. The room was clean. A little noisy as people tended to stand under the window to smoke... I could have shut the window, but I was enjoying the ocean sounds too much for that!! The grounds are pretty and the continental breakfast was perfect before setting out for a full day of sight seeing...

Reviews.Title: “need a remodel”
Reviews.Author: jksabre
Reviews.Content: The hotel was basically clean but very outdated. Carpet was old and the windows sucked. Small towels in Bathroom.Tight fit parking lot. On our section of hotel to go outside to parking lot had to walk all the way down to one side of unit then walk all the way back outside. Crazy. This is probably legal but hallways had no sprinklers but a series of small fire extinguishers in the hall way. I guess for the price it was ok if you were not going to stay in hotel very much. Oh the Continental sucked if you like nutrition No bagels or cereal. Next time I will probably go to a diffrent place.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: GirlMouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because we had to (a late flight in, so did not want to drive in the dark). And will never stay again. The personnel was friendly but that is just about as far as it gets. The bed was a nightmare, room way below average and the whole building was old and not well taken care of. The vending machines were out of everything (and were the only place to buy anything at night) and the breakfast was basically non-existent. For this price in the mainland you stay in motels which are ten times better than this one! Next time I will book a flight that is in Maui earlier and just head streight to the beach locations. Kahului is just not worth staying a night, nor even seeing for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY! ! :-(.. Pit Stop”
Reviews.Author: LindaAndelLady
Reviews.Content: The pictures look nice, and maybe some rooms were... ours was at the right front by the door.. Room clean, but not updated. Beds were not very comfortable... I used my own matress on the floor after things settled down a bit. Parking out our window at ground level, and we had nothing but bumpers to look at.. in fact kind of scarry at the time because it looked like a car could come in your room easily if they failed to stop or accidentally gunned it. The other issues was the "safe coded" door. All kinds of people and women were asking for the code all night and the undesirable traffice was horrific. Very scarry for us to feel safe while we left my mom so that we could go pick up food. We called security due to traffic and constant propositions and begging at door for security code...no one came. It was a very scarry night! Later , my nephew on Oahu told us that that was a cheaper hotel that many locals stay at who come over to Maui to work for the week. You do get what you pay for. If cheap is what you want then go for it! Oh if you are planning on touring during they day, don't plan on a dip in the pool. IT CLOSES VERY EARLY... SORRY I CAN'T REMEMBER EXACTLY WHAT TIME, BUT EVEN WHILE IT WAS STILL DAYLIGHT.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again. Horrible”
Reviews.Author: beachbum311
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night to Maui and couldn't get a rental car from enterprise to go all the way to Wailea Beach where we would be staying for our vacation so we stayed at this Motel by the airport for just one night, and we're thankful it was only for one night otherwise we would've rather stayed at the gas station accross the street. This place was horrible, there were all kinds of bugs in the room and it smelled like a dumpster. It was so old and crowded I think everyone staying there was defenetly in a really tight budget. Rooms were old, almost couldnt find a parking spot, smells, it was alright I guess for just one night. We checked out at 6am though, couldn't deal with it any longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: WorryFreeTravel
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews --as we all do. I had mixed feelings of this property. First, when we arrived around 11 am checked with t he front desk to see if any rooms would be avail knowing check in was at 3pm. They had a full night before - so to check in was not going to happen - however, the front desk person took all the info - cc name etc and when we did return late that evening our room was ready with the key. I gave this hotel a an above avg rating - because it exceeded my expectations of a 2 star property. Could not see the outside of the room since it was already dark. But the inside of the room was very clean, however, small. It served the purpose of our one night stay. Next morning we woke up to a view of the bay, landscaping at the property very nice - better than some more expensive hotels. Bathroom was small but comfortable and clean. All that mattered -- mattered. Close to airport - and highway for travel to other parts of the island. Glad to have chosen this property and will return when the time presents to visist Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average. You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: platano
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay. It is located just minutes from the airport in Kahului. For the future, I will choose a different hotel with more amenities. I arrived at 10:00am, but check-in time wasn't until 3:00pm. The hotel has a very musky smell throughout that I had to get used to for my six day stay. The continental breakfast consists of orange juice, coffee, pineapple and a muffin. The hotel does not have a dining area for lunch or dinner. The room did have a small refrigerator, but unfortunately did not have a microwave or an iron. There was a small air conditioner along with an overhead fan which kept the room cool from the outside heat. Parking can be a little rough, especially if you arrive late at night. Unfortunately, I had to contact the hotel two weeks later because my credit card statement reflected that I was double charged for my stay. Overall, if you're not going to spend a lot of time at the hotel, it's worth spending less to stay at this hotel and spending more on the island activities. Otherwise, find a hotel in Kihei, where there are more activities and dining facilities nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for One Night”
Reviews.Author: gsp_lab
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night as our flight from LA was due to land around 8:30 pm. It took about one hour to get baggage and rental car. Why pay resort prices when you are arriving at that time of night? This is an older hotel that would hardly considered to be nice, so it's best to go in with that type of expectation. But it's nice enough for one night. The room was clean and the hotel was quiet. Bed was decent. Staff was friendly. Rate was decent. Continental breakfast was okay, though nothing special. Had a nice view from the hotel window. This hotel provides an excellent staging point for the Road to Hana (which we did the next day) and allows you to do any last minute shopping at WalMart, Costco or a grocery store before heading to your condo/hotel.

Reviews.Title: “On the beach, but a little run down.”
Reviews.Author: wine4more
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a place to sleep on our way from home to our condo on Molokai. We needed a cheap, decent place for two nights on Maui while we shopped prior to going to Molokai. This place was 'okay'. The exterior was not great, but okay. The room was not so nice. Basic and a bit on the run down side. The pool area was okay and it is right on the beach and one block from a mall on Maui. Would I book there again.....probably not. For a cheap place it was $138 a night. Even by Maui standards it was not great. We could have rented a condo for that price and had a nicer place with a pool also.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacky999
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s the cheapest hotel that we could find during our stay in Maui. we stayed there for 2 days without any inconvenience. People were very kind there. I like it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, inexpensive place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DocDon
Reviews.Content: I read a few of the reviews on this hotel after I had already booked it on AARP passport a couple of months earlier. We had requested a quiet room and were very happy with the room they gave us. The staff were all very friendly and most helpful. The hotel was a tourist class 60's but had awesome views and the room was very neat and clean the towels were very soft, fluffy and abundent. It is close to the airport (but not noisy) and has many malls and shopping centers close by. Our flight left at 9 PM so we ask for a late check out giving us plenty of time to pack and the request was granted. We had plenty of hot water, nice TV, clock radio, secure parking and night entrance was only permited thru the front lobby. Never seen the first bug or any type of rodent. I would have to give this hotel a 2 1/2 star or or better rating due to the quaility of furniture,staff being very good and just plain polite. Doc

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: janiee
Reviews.Content: We were not so sure what to expect. A little worried and wondering if we may have had made a terrible choice after reading the reviews. But let me tell you, all of our tensions went out of the window when we first arrived. The check in clerk was soooo friendly and upgraded us to the best suite for no charge. I have no clue why, but I did'nt hang around to ask questions. The suite had a sitting room with a few chairs,a sofa, a tv and a wonderful view of the bay. The bedroom was very big and so was the restroom. Our room was very neat and clean. The grounds of the hotel were immaculate and the view to the bay was really beautiful. We had a wonderful time and had not one problem. The clerks at the front dest were very helpful with suggestions on where to visit and eat and calling the taxi for us. All in all, it was very pleasant and we will be going back next year. Thank you Seaside Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: laffer
Reviews.Content: Basically you get what you pay for at this joint. The hotel is perfect for those getting into Maui late at night. It's 5 min drive from the Kahului airport. At this hour, with possible jet lag, you probably don't want to be searching /driving far for a night to stay. The hotel is generally dated, carpet is old, hallway is dark, has that leftover musty smell from the 70's (most likely used to be a smoking hotel). We chose a standard /non-oceanview room. The room is clean, AC, and quiet. We went for continental breakfast the following morning and checked out. The hotel security guy was one friendly guy, he gave us an updated Frommer's Hawaii guidebook to keep! Stay here only at the start of your trip, then move your way up to nicer and more $$$ hotels.... :)

Reviews.Title: “Very well kept, charming, authentic Hawaiian service”
Reviews.Author: CassandraMack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely seaside hotel on my first trip to Hawaii. The hotel is all open air and the breeze flows through at all hours of the day. When you walk into the hotel lobby, you can see straight through to the ocean and it's really very nice. Our room was large, clean, and service was very good. The building is older and has an authentic Hawaiian decor which is not as flashy and overstated as the rest of the US and most high priced hotels you will find in the area. Every morning you have your choice of muffins, toast, wonderful fresh fruits and juices and an open air seat to start off your day. So, if you're looking to save 75% on hotel costs and still stay in a nice play, I would highly recommend the Maui Seaside hotel. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, if your'e not expecting much”
Reviews.Author: NancyfromGoldrush
Reviews.Content: Like many other travellers, my husband and I stayed here after a late flight from LAX. We were given a key to a room that I happily realized would have an ocean view when we woke up to our first morning in Maui. When we hauled all our luggage up there, I noticed a Do Not Disturb sign on the door. I figured the maid might have left it. You can imagine my suprise when I saw people sleeping in "my" bed. It was after midnight, our time, and now we had to go back downstairs. The desk clerk didn't say a thing. Our final room was clean and the bed quite comfortable. It had no view, but then it had no other people in it either! The breakfast that was included was a little odd. It was only from 7-8:30. When they ran out of hard boiled eggs at 7:15, they were out for the duration. But it was a little coffee and muffin that I wasn't expecting so that was good. Another good thing--the hotel is so close to the airport, most car rental agencies will pick you up for free. They will call for you from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for a one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: wovermyer
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer, we stayed here one night after a late flight into Kahului. The front desk staff was very nice, and security were patrolling the parking lot. The room was large, but not in the main courtyard area, instead it was in a 3-story building with no view of the ocean. The rooms are older, but ours was clean. There are no hair dryers or extra amenities in the room, and it smelled musty. We got up too late to try the free breakfast (its only from 7-8:30 am) The parking lot was full by the time we arrived at 10:30 p.m., and we had to park in the "annex" lot in a neighboring park. It was a bit of a walk back to the front of the hotel to get to our room. Overall, it served its purpose for our overnight stay, and is close to grocery stores if you're stocking up for your trip (we drove to Hana the next day). I wouldn't recommend staying here longer than a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cantonjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in June and I wish we could've stayed longer at this hotel. The price was fab, the room was large and clean and the staff was very friendly. It's close to everything and lots of parking available. We stayed at the owner's other hotel in Hilo on the Big Island and loved that hotel also! Definitely a great value!

Reviews.Title: “All Ok. Friendly and recommended”
Reviews.Author: adamcole
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the budget side, but for one night and maybe even more its cheap, clean, in a good location and has a friendly staff. I had read all the reports, and decided to take the chance as it is close to the airport, and we did not want to drive to Lahaina after the long flight. Rooms were comfortable, clean and the breakfast was fine - anything free on Maui is unusual. Don't sweat all the reviews, don't expect a mansion and just feel good after you stay there knowing that you saved a few dollars and that its all you really needed in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: akgt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in maui seaside hotel. We really loved our stay there. We arrived at the lobby at 12 instead of 3:00 pm and still were given an early checkin. Also we got a room upgrade from standard to deluxe. The view from the room was very good as it was partial oceanview. As for the room it is very spacious .....very clean .. The atmosphere at the hotel is very nice and the staff is friendly. At night one can walk on the beach adjoining the hotel. If you are visiting maui for the first time .. this is the place to stay as location from the airport is key to this hotel .... just 5 mins drive, and also 5-10 mins to costco for stocking up on your stay . Complimentry breakfast is nice too. No parking problems at all. Overall the feel to the hotel is very good and i would highly recommed it .

Reviews.Title: “A Clean, Friendly Hotel for the Budget Minded”
Reviews.Author: Kanawha
Reviews.Content: I had visited Maui a few years ago and stayed at one of the fancy resort places. I had no desire to pay for fluff and wanted an economical place as a base for our excursions on this visit. I got the Maui Seaside through Hotwire, and was concerned when I read some of the reviews. I must say that we enjoyed the Maui Seaside. The front desk staff was very friendly and accomodating to our needs. Our room was extremely clean and had air conditioning which could be set to the desired temperature. I have stayed in three star and four star hotels of a higher price which were not as clean or had staff as accomodating as the staff at the Maui Seaside. The room which we had was very quiet, so we really slept well on comfortable beds. Our room was on the lower level facing the pool. The continental breakfast included fruit, assorted muffins, hard boiled eggs, toast, etc. and was sufficient to keep us going for most of the day. Anyone who has been to Maui knows that dining out can be expensive, so this breakfast represented a significant savings and provided the energy to keep us going until we dined out in the evening. We used the Maui Seaside for our base for our travel excursions as everything could be reached easily from it since Maui isn't that big. Money saved on a room to sleep is money that can be spent on experiences outside of a hotel. We talked with an individual who was a guest at the hotel as a result of a business activity. She stated that her company always booked their employees into the Maui Seaside when they were conducting business in that area. We would definitely stay at the Maui Seaside again as we had a very positive experience. I do not have photos available at this time but will in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for 11 nights. I have read alot of negitive reveiws of this hotel, even before we left to stay there. My husband and I were very pleased with our stay. I used to live on Maui in Wailuku, and wanted to stay in Kahului, because it would be close to my town and Baldwin school, and a good location to travel around the island, and easy to get to the Airport. It really was great after a 17 hour trip to be only 7 minutes away from the airport. We thought that the beach was great, lots of shells. The room was kept very clean, and if we asked for extra items we were given them. The grounds were kept very clean and the pool was great. I was pleased to have access to a laundry room. The only thing that I would ask a little improvement on would be the breakfast. Muffins, dounuts, juice, reg coffee, bread, hard boiled eggs and oranges. I would like to have seen Mango, Pineapple, milk, and perked decaf. coffee, I don't like packaged Sanka. We would stay there again, and would recomend it to people. N.H.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for our trip!”
Reviews.Author: RaquelKetterman
Reviews.Content: We read mixed reviews regarding this hotel. Basically those writing lesser than positive were looking for a resort type stay. Location was fantastic! Walkable community in Kahului. Ease of transportation by rental car. Great shopping mall nearby for last minute items. Wonderful acesses to the Arts Center where we saw Jack Johnson and Friends (reason we booked the trip). We were able to walk to the concert safely and easily. We could get to all areas of the island easily and quickly from Maui Seaside. Each trip to a beach or park was breathtaking. Room was clean, staff was very friendly and accomodating! breakfast was something to be desired - but free. I prefer something more healthy. We hope to have the opportunity to visit Maui and stay at your hotel once again! We would certainly book a room at Maui Seaside again! This was our most relaxing vacation EVER! Mahalo Maui! Raquel Ketterman

Reviews.Title: “Clean place to sleep and shower”
Reviews.Author: yesngo
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review before, but because I've found the reviews I've read very helpful, I thought I'd pass along the favor. We stayed at the Maui Seaside over the president's day weekend and were pleasantly surprised. The trip was booked through Travelocity. The front desk folks were friendly and check-in was very quick. They didn't even need my credit card as a deposit. The hotel is old, with dated decor, but room was very clean and the shower had adequate pressure. The air conditioner worked fine. The beds had either Serta or Sealy brand mattresses (I noticed it when the sheets came undone), and were comfortable. The pool looked clean, although we never used it. The FREE continental breakfast was good and very useful in pricey Maui. The location was actually pretty good, close to the Mall, airport, start of Hana Road and the Crator. When I go on vacation, I generally don't like the room to be made up everyday. So I left the DO NOT DISTURB sign on for 4 days, and they completely respected it. My idea of a hotel is really just a place to come back, shower, and sleep. If you're looking for a resort to hang out at, this is not the place for you. However, if you want a CLEAN place to sleep and shower, with FREE breakfast in the morning, all at a good price, then you should definitely consider Maui Seaside.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient start for our Maui vacation”
Reviews.Author: crayz2sew
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I just returned from our vacation to Maui. We thought that the Maui Seaside Hotel was a convenient place to start our vacation. It was close to the airport and easy to get to. We planned on driving the road to Hana the next day and needed a place to stay overnight. This worked great. The staff was pleasant and the free breakfast was good. The rooms aren't huge and I wouldn't want to spend a whole week there (I wouldn't want to spend a whole week in Kahului, either) but for our needs it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel because of the price, but I found too many inconveniences for my taste. The rooms are small but comfortable (ask to stay in the tower for a larger room). If you need to iron, forget it! You have to take your clothes DOWN to the laundry room and iron them with a horrible iron chained to the board! Not my idea of a comfortable room experience.

Reviews.Title: “Easy on the budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only stayed three nights and that was enough. The down side is the room smelled musty and gross. The place is not fancy, but we weren't there to spend in the hotel room. The pool was too cold to swim in. Beach is average. The air conditioning unit was very noisy and kept us awake the first night. We told the management and it was fixed right away. We also needed another blanket, no problem. The people were very friendly and the breakfast was good. Plan on 40+ drive to any attractions. Probably wouldn't stay here again. But for those on a budget like we were, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: eos_domestic_goddess
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Maui 10:30PM, and based on the Nov. review, reserved our first night stay here. It's less than a 10 minute drive from the airport, and it is a perfectly good motel for a short stay;clean and comfortable. They offer a continental breakfast that helped us get on our way to our destination. I would definitely stay there again for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the airport”
Reviews.Author: JBaj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night at the start of our Maui vacation, after arriving late at the airport. Our expectations weren't grand - we needed somewhere clean to shower and sleep before setting out early the next morning. The Maui Seaside was ideal for us - the welcome was friendly, the room was a little dated but clean and confortable, and we had a nice view over a small beach. I certainly wouldn't recommend that anyone stay here for longer than a few nights, but for one night it's more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Maui Seaside left MUCH to be desired. The room was tiny and rundown, with ancient 70's style decor. The AC did not work well at all, and housekeeping turned it off each day when they came to clean, meaning we returned from each day of sightseeing to a steaming hot room that took hours to cool again. The location is central, pool and grounds are actually quite nice. I was there for a conference so it was convenient for me, but this is most definitely NOT a vacation spot. Considering that the place is not particularly nice, it is definitely overpriced. For $20 more, you can get a MUCH nicer and more modern place. They give you breakfast coupons for their highly overpriced and not particularly good restaurant, again, not worth it. Stay away-- try the town of Kihei if you want something not too far from Central Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Skip This One!”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: Maui is beautiful, but what a disappointment we had with this place. The rooms themselves were adequate, but tropical paradise this is not! When you go to the beach (if you could call it that) by the hotel, you get a view of a shipyard. Spend more money and get a nicer place in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Average but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Lu2006
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just okay, but you get for what you pay. Don't expect anything and you won't be disappointed. The room was clean but the air conditioner was noisy. We had a partial ocean view which was nice. You can walk out to see ocean but you can't swim there. The hotel is conveniently located; near by shopping areas, KMart, Costco, and centrally located for driving within all the key tourist sites. If you won't be staying much in the room and don't need the frills and 'vacation' environment, then this hotel will do.

Reviews.Title: “little bit old but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel looks little bit old inside , outside but i could feel very relaxed atmosphere when i enter the lobby. This area is very convenient and you can find a couple of shopping mall with easy drive. You may not like this hotel if you want to enjoy bathing time.(shower room has no bath tub and the room is small, not very very small, i guess and water pressure is not so good) there is a small fridge and one coffee table,two chairs in the room and we could enjoy some to-go foods there. the room was very clean and there was no funny smell like nicotine. AC worked pretty good. people who works there was very nice. if you are very active tourists and don't spend too much time in the hotel and don't care too much details, this is the one you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've been to Maui several times and always stay at the Maui Seaside. The rooms are just a basic room but they are clean and quiet. For the price I haven't been able to find anything better. I would rather save my money on a room and spend it elsewhere, all we do is sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Its Ok,Great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here, My husbands first. I admit, It is not a fancy hotel, No FREEBIES in the rooms as shampoo or conditioner, no iron, there is one in the laundry room, the bar has since closed down. the restaurant food is good but on my stay in 2003 it was MUCH better! I have seen a few things that have gone downhill, BUt the staff is great, maid service excellent. ANd the one who wrote about cockroaches! we were here for 9 days, not once did we see a cockroach or Gecko (as they are properly called) in our room, LOts of Geckos outside at dusk, but thats ok, they are harmless and eat bugs! As for the location, its good, we are in central Maui and very close to everything. The cruise ships that come in are quite beautiful. we had booked so many things to do once in Maui we were only in our rooms to sleep. The pool is nice AND quiet. not many kids here to be screaming, to me that is the worst thing when a kid screams around a pool. they should be told not to. It is only open till 6 pm though which is quite a bummer, cuz several times we wanted to go in at night. they say its because they have no lighting, although we thought it is very well lit. The rooms are ok, we had a ground floor with a Patio, last year I had a very big room with two double beds and kitchenette on the third floor. Be advised THERE ARE NO COFFEE POTS OR ALARM CLOCKS AS stated IN EXPEDIA! there are small refridgerators in all rooms. it was not fun dragging suitcases up there! The parking can be terrible around 10 pm. but you just park in the other lot. As for staying here, Yes we will, because of the money we saved to get to do all the stuff we did. And I like to bring my own toiletries anyway. Half the time they stink in hotels! give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Be realistic - you got what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Mauigirl808
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at the Seaside but stayed at the Maui Beach hotel in Wailuku, which is similar and also below my standards, but...... If you are going to travel be realistic. Don't be surprised at finding cockroaches and geckos in Hawaii. If you want a nice room for under a $100 go to Waikiki. This is Maui - where a 1920's bungalow in Kahului sells for more than half a million dollars. You can't go cheap on Maui and expect a resort.
