The main tourist areas are Kihei to Wailea and Lahaina to Kapalua. What were you doing in Kahului - its where the real people live. The most interesting parts of Maui are off the beaten path which most tourists will never experience.

Reviews.Title: “My gosh what did you expect people?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is almost comical reading the above mentioned reviews-Cmon folks what did you expect when booking at this location? ( okay I will give you the name of the hotel does have the resort feel to it)However when doing your homework it is clear this hotel is a base before starting your vacation and that is what we did - as our plane arrived in Maui at 8.00pm complicate that with a 10 y.o.,a 5 hr time difference a 45 minute drive to resort we were staying at and jet lag I wanted a place close to OGG to rest the night.As hotel is 5 miles from airport and knowing we would be jet lagged etc I didnt feel like dishing out the $240.00 for my first night in Maui.The HOTEL is on the old side and yes rooms are very small but I will say staff are great the grounds are spotless and our ROOM was VERY Very CLEAN and COZY- Nice sounds of the waves put us to sleep. In the morning thier was a brief rain shower and as soon as it stopped 4 staff memebers were out by the pool area drying off the lounge chairs- BY 11.00am we were refreshed from a good nights sleep and my pocket book felt good b/c i only spent 85.00 fopr the room ( good buy comsidering we all crashed within 20 mins of putting our head down on the pillow)We spent 8 days at our resort in Kanapalli and on the last day we checked in again at the Seaside(due to 11.45pm flight) We did the beach and used the hotel to freshen up in b/f heading to the airport-

Reviews.Title: “Great people, good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for a cheap, short stay. I wouldn't recomend a "vacation" here. No beaches very near by, rooms are clean and fine, but nothing extra, pool area was good, but not the "Maui" experience. I do have to say that the front desk staff was the most genuinely nicest group I have EVER interacted with at a hotel. I WOULD recomend a stay here if you need a place to stay for one or two nights at the most, it is just an affordable place to sleep, no real "vacation" feel to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for whiny, faux-sophisticate tourists”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to plant your butt on the hotel grounds and not actually experience the island, don't stay here. Kahului is a real town, not a tourist oasis, so you will run into *GASP* real Hawaiians here, and the hotel is no exception. The room was small, but it was clean, and for the most part we spent little time in it, anyway. Think of it as going camping, and the room is your tent : a place to leave your stuff while you are outside doing other things. The place is central to the whole island (Lahaina, Hana, and Kihei are about equidistant from this location), so if you are smart and rent a car it is a great home base. The parking lot could use some revising (bigger spaces, for one), and it's not that quiet, but nothing bad happened regarding the room. Vi's restaraunt isn't the best, but the breakfast will get you started in the morning just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Much”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Beagle
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Maui at midnight we stayed here for one evening prior to departing to Wailea. Keep your expectations very low and it will be bearable. Relative to other Maui hotels, it is not even worth the $85 that we paid. The only positive comment that I could muster is that we did not see any insects in our room. I expect that you would have to have very low standards to be pleased with these accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking on the internet for the least expensive place to stay on Maui and this is what I found. I don't know if it is but... I just returned home to Oahu and I think I got what I expected there. I do wish that they had supplied at least small bottles of shampoo and lotion though. Also, the parking is free but limited. If you are returning to your room at night you may not find a parking spot. I also wish the parking stalls were wider. Most times I had to have my companion get out of the car before I could park. I got to stay in the poolside rooms and I liked it. As long as you don't expect too much you will be pleased with the hotel because the staff is very friendly and the location is near the airport. If you are staying on maui, you should not be spending much time in your room anyway! There is so much to see and do! For the price I paid, you could get a better room in Waikiki but for Maui, where everything costs a bit more, it was fine.

HotelInfo.Name: Maui Seaside Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 100 West Kaahumanu Avenue, Kahului, Maui, HI 96732
